00071 static inline cfs_time_t round_timeout(cfs_time_t timeout)
00072 {
00073         return cfs_time_seconds((int)cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_sub(timeout, 0)) + 1);
00074 }
00075 
00076 /* timeout for initial callback (AST) reply (bz10399) */
00077 static inline unsigned int ldlm_get_rq_timeout(void)
00078 {
00079         /* Non-AT value */
00080         unsigned int timeout = min(ldlm_timeout, obd_timeout / 3);
00081 
00082         return timeout < 1 ? 1 : timeout;
00083 }

00085 #define ELT_STOPPED   0
00086 #define ELT_READY     1
00087 #define ELT_TERMINATE 2
00088 
00089 struct ldlm_bl_pool {
00090         spinlock_t              blp_lock;
00091 
00092         /*
00093          * blp_prio_list is used for callbacks that should be handled
00094          * as a priority. It is used for LDLM_FL_DISCARD_DATA requests.
00095          * see bug 13843
00096          */
00097         struct list_head              blp_prio_list;
00098 
00099         /*
00100          * blp_list is used for all other callbacks which are likely
00101          * to take longer to process.
00102          */
00103         struct list_head              blp_list;
00104 
00105         wait_queue_head_t       blp_waitq;
00106         struct completion       blp_comp;
00107         atomic_t            blp_num_threads;
00108         atomic_t            blp_busy_threads;
00109         int                     blp_min_threads;
00110         int                     blp_max_threads;
00111 };
00112 
00113 struct ldlm_bl_work_item {
00114         struct list_head        blwi_entry;
00115         struct ldlm_namespace   *blwi_ns;
00116         struct ldlm_lock_desc   blwi_ld;
00117         struct ldlm_lock        *blwi_lock;
00118         struct list_head        blwi_head;
00119         int                     blwi_count;
00120         struct completion       blwi_comp;
00121         enum ldlm_cancel_flags  blwi_flags;
00122         int                     blwi_mem_pressure;
00123 };

00130 static spinlock_t waiting_locks_spinlock;   /* BH lock (timer) */
00131 
00143 static struct list_head waiting_locks_list;
00144 static struct timer_list waiting_locks_timer;
00145 
00146 static struct expired_lock_thread {
00147         wait_queue_head_t       elt_waitq;
00148         int                     elt_state;
00149         int                     elt_dump;
00150         struct list_head                elt_expired_locks;
00151 } expired_lock_thread;
00152 
00153 static inline int have_expired_locks(void)
00154 {
00155         int need_to_run;
00156 
00157         ENTRY;
00158         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00159         need_to_run = !list_empty(&expired_lock_thread.elt_expired_locks);
00160         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00161 
00162         RETURN(need_to_run);
00163 }
00164 
00168 static int expired_lock_main(void *arg)
00169 {
00170         struct list_head *expired = &expired_lock_thread.elt_expired_locks;
00171         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00172         int do_dump;
00173 
00174         ENTRY;
00175 
00176         expired_lock_thread.elt_state = ELT_READY;
00177         wake_up(&expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq);
00178 
00179         while (1) {
00180                 l_wait_event(expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq,
00181                              have_expired_locks() ||
00182                              expired_lock_thread.elt_state == ELT_TERMINATE,
00183                              &lwi);
00184 
00185                 spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00186                 if (expired_lock_thread.elt_dump) {
00187                         struct libcfs_debug_msg_data msgdata = {
00188                                 .msg_file = __FILE__,
00189                                 .msg_fn = "waiting_locks_callback",
00190                                 .msg_line = expired_lock_thread.elt_dump };
00191                         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00192 
00193                         /* from waiting_locks_callback, but not in timer */
00194                         libcfs_debug_dumplog();
00195                         libcfs_run_lbug_upcall(&msgdata);
00196 
00197                         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00198                         expired_lock_thread.elt_dump = 0;
00199                 }
00200 
00201                 do_dump = 0;
00202 
00203                 while (!list_empty(expired)) {
00204                         struct obd_export *export;
00205                         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00206 
00207                         lock = list_entry(expired->next, struct ldlm_lock,
00208                                           l_pending_chain);
00209                         if ((void *)lock < LP_POISON + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE &&
00210                             (void *)lock >= LP_POISON) {
00211                                 spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00212                                 CERROR("free lock on elt list %p\n", lock);
00213                                 LBUG();
00214                         }
00215                         list_del_init(&lock->l_pending_chain);
00216                         if ((void *)lock->l_export <
00217                              LP_POISON + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE &&
00218                             (void *)lock->l_export >= LP_POISON) {
00219                                 CERROR("lock with free export on elt list %p\n",
00220                                        lock->l_export);
00221                                 lock->l_export = NULL;
00222                                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "free export");
00223                                 /* release extra ref grabbed by
00224                                  * ldlm_add_waiting_lock() or
00225                                  * ldlm_failed_ast() */
00226                                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00227                                 continue;
00228                         }
00229 
00230                         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
00231                                 /* release the lock refcount where
00232                                  * waiting_locks_callback() founds */
00233                                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00234                                 continue;
00235                         }
00236                         export = class_export_lock_get(lock->l_export, lock);
00237                         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00238 
00239                         spin_lock_bh(&export->exp_bl_list_lock);
00240                         list_del_init(&lock->l_exp_list);
00241                         spin_unlock_bh(&export->exp_bl_list_lock);
00242 
00243                         do_dump++;
00244                         class_fail_export(export);
00245                         class_export_lock_put(export, lock);
00246 
00247                         /* release extra ref grabbed by ldlm_add_waiting_lock()
00248                          * or ldlm_failed_ast() */
00249                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00250 
00251                         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00252                 }
00253                 spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00254 
00255                 if (do_dump && obd_dump_on_eviction) {
00256                         CERROR("dump the log upon eviction\n");
00257                         libcfs_debug_dumplog();
00258                 }
00259 
00260                 if (expired_lock_thread.elt_state == ELT_TERMINATE)
00261                         break;
00262         }
00263 
00264         expired_lock_thread.elt_state = ELT_STOPPED;
00265         wake_up(&expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq);
00266         RETURN(0);
00267 }
00268 
00269 static int ldlm_add_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock);
00270 static int __ldlm_add_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock, int seconds);
00271 
00276 static int ldlm_lock_busy(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00277 {
00278         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00279         int match = 0;
00280         ENTRY;
00281 
00282         if (lock->l_export == NULL)
00283                 return 0;
00284 
00285         spin_lock_bh(&lock->l_export->exp_rpc_lock);
00286         list_for_each_entry(req, &lock->l_export->exp_hp_rpcs,
00287                                 rq_exp_list) {
00288                 if (req->rq_ops->hpreq_lock_match) {
00289                         match = req->rq_ops->hpreq_lock_match(req, lock);
00290                         if (match)
00291                                 break;
00292                 }
00293         }
00294         spin_unlock_bh(&lock->l_export->exp_rpc_lock);
00295         RETURN(match);
00296 }
00297 
00298 /* This is called from within a timer interrupt and cannot schedule */
00299 static void waiting_locks_callback(unsigned long unused)
00300 {
00301         struct ldlm_lock        *lock;
00302         int                     need_dump = 0;
00303 
00304         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00305         while (!list_empty(&waiting_locks_list)) {
00306                 lock = list_entry(waiting_locks_list.next, struct ldlm_lock,
00307                                       l_pending_chain);
00308                 if (cfs_time_after(lock->l_callback_timeout,
00309                                    cfs_time_current()) ||
00310                     (lock->l_req_mode == LCK_GROUP))
00311                         break;
00312 
00313                 /* Check if we need to prolong timeout */
00314                 if (!OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_HPREQ_TIMEOUT) &&
00315                     ldlm_lock_busy(lock)) {
00316                         int cont = 1;
00317 
00318                         if (lock->l_pending_chain.next == &waiting_locks_list)
00319                                 cont = 0;
00320 
00321                         LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
00322 
00323                         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00324                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "prolong the busy lock");
00325                         ldlm_refresh_waiting_lock(lock,
00326                                                   ldlm_bl_timeout(lock) >> 1);
00327                         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00328 
00329                         if (!cont) {
00330                                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00331                                 break;
00332                         }
00333 
00334                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00335                         continue;
00336                 }
00337                 ldlm_lock_to_ns(lock)->ns_timeouts++;
00338                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock callback timer expired after %lds: "
00339                            "evicting client at %s ",
00340                            cfs_time_current_sec() - lock->l_last_activity,
00341                            libcfs_nid2str(
00342                                    lock->l_export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid));
00343 
00344                 /* no needs to take an extra ref on the lock since it was in
00345                  * the waiting_locks_list and ldlm_add_waiting_lock()
00346                  * already grabbed a ref */
00347                 list_del(&lock->l_pending_chain);
00348                 list_add(&lock->l_pending_chain,
00349                              &expired_lock_thread.elt_expired_locks);
00350                 need_dump = 1;
00351         }
00352 
00353         if (!list_empty(&expired_lock_thread.elt_expired_locks)) {
00354                 if (obd_dump_on_timeout && need_dump)
00355                         expired_lock_thread.elt_dump = __LINE__;
00356 
00357                 wake_up(&expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq);
00358         }
00359 
00360         /*
00361          * Make sure the timer will fire again if we have any locks
00362          * left.
00363          */
00364         if (!list_empty(&waiting_locks_list)) {
00365                 cfs_time_t timeout_rounded;
00366                 lock = list_entry(waiting_locks_list.next, struct ldlm_lock,
00367                                       l_pending_chain);
00368                 timeout_rounded = (cfs_time_t)round_timeout(lock->l_callback_timeout);
00369                 cfs_timer_arm(&waiting_locks_timer, timeout_rounded);
00370         }
00371         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00372 }
00373 
00386 static int __ldlm_add_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock, int seconds)
00387 {
00388         cfs_time_t timeout;
00389         cfs_time_t timeout_rounded;
00390 
00391         if (!list_empty(&lock->l_pending_chain))
00392                 return 0;
00393 
00394         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_HPREQ_NOTIMEOUT) ||
00395             OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_HPREQ_TIMEOUT))
00396                 seconds = 1;
00397 
00398         timeout = cfs_time_shift(seconds);
00399         if (likely(cfs_time_after(timeout, lock->l_callback_timeout)))
00400                 lock->l_callback_timeout = timeout;
00401 
00402         timeout_rounded = round_timeout(lock->l_callback_timeout);
00403 
00404         if (cfs_time_before(timeout_rounded,
00405                             cfs_timer_deadline(&waiting_locks_timer)) ||
00406             !cfs_timer_is_armed(&waiting_locks_timer)) {
00407                 cfs_timer_arm(&waiting_locks_timer, timeout_rounded);
00408         }
00409         /* if the new lock has a shorter timeout than something earlier on
00410            the list, we'll wait the longer amount of time; no big deal. */
00411         /* FIFO */
00412         list_add_tail(&lock->l_pending_chain, &waiting_locks_list);
00413         return 1;
00414 }
00415 
00416 static void ldlm_add_blocked_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00417 {
00418         spin_lock_bh(&lock->l_export->exp_bl_list_lock);
00419         if (list_empty(&lock->l_exp_list)) {
00420                 if (lock->l_granted_mode != lock->l_req_mode)
00421                         list_add_tail(&lock->l_exp_list,
00422                                       &lock->l_export->exp_bl_list);
00423                 else
00424                         list_add(&lock->l_exp_list,
00425                                  &lock->l_export->exp_bl_list);
00426         }
00427         spin_unlock_bh(&lock->l_export->exp_bl_list_lock);
00428 
00429         /* A blocked lock is added. Adjust the position in
00430          * the stale list if the export is in the list.
00431          * If export is stale and not in the list - it is being
00432          * processed and will be placed on the right position
00433          * on obd_stale_export_put(). */
00434         if (!list_empty(&lock->l_export->exp_stale_list))
00435                 obd_stale_export_adjust(lock->l_export);
00436 }
00437 
00438 static int ldlm_add_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00439 {
00440         int ret;
00441         int timeout = ldlm_bl_timeout(lock);
00442 
00443         /* NB: must be called with hold of lock_res_and_lock() */
00444         LASSERT(ldlm_is_res_locked(lock));
00445         LASSERT(!ldlm_is_cancel_on_block(lock));
00446 
00447         /* Do not put cross-MDT lock in the waiting list, since we
00448          * will not evict it due to timeout for now */
00449         if (lock->l_export != NULL &&
00450             (exp_connect_flags(lock->l_export) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS))
00451                 return 0;
00452 
00453         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00454         if (ldlm_is_cancel(lock)) {
00455                 spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00456                 return 0;
00457         }
00458 
00459         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
00460                 static cfs_time_t next;
00461 
00462                 spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00463                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "not waiting on destroyed lock (bug 5653)");
00464                 if (cfs_time_after(cfs_time_current(), next)) {
00465                         next = cfs_time_shift(14400);
00466                         libcfs_debug_dumpstack(NULL);
00467                 }
00468                 return 0;
00469         }
00470 
00471         ldlm_set_waited(lock);
00472         lock->l_last_activity = cfs_time_current_sec();
00473         ret = __ldlm_add_waiting_lock(lock, timeout);
00474         if (ret) {
00475                 /* grab ref on the lock if it has been added to the
00476                  * waiting list */
00477                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
00478         }
00479         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00480 
00481         if (ret)
00482                 ldlm_add_blocked_lock(lock);
00483 
00484         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "%sadding to wait list(timeout: %d, AT: %s)",
00485                    ret == 0 ? "not re-" : "", timeout,
00486                    AT_OFF ? "off" : "on");
00487         return ret;
00488 }
00489 
00499 static int __ldlm_del_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00500 {
00501         struct list_head *list_next;
00502 
00503         if (list_empty(&lock->l_pending_chain))
00504                 return 0;
00505 
00506         list_next = lock->l_pending_chain.next;
00507         if (lock->l_pending_chain.prev == &waiting_locks_list) {
00508                 /* Removing the head of the list, adjust timer. */
00509                 if (list_next == &waiting_locks_list) {
00510                         /* No more, just cancel. */
00511                         cfs_timer_disarm(&waiting_locks_timer);
00512                 } else {
00513                         struct ldlm_lock *next;
00514                         next = list_entry(list_next, struct ldlm_lock,
00515                                               l_pending_chain);
00516                         cfs_timer_arm(&waiting_locks_timer,
00517                                       round_timeout(next->l_callback_timeout));
00518                 }
00519         }
00520         list_del_init(&lock->l_pending_chain);
00521 
00522         return 1;
00523 }
00524 
00525 int ldlm_del_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00526 {
00527         int ret;
00528 
00529         if (lock->l_export == NULL) {
00530                 /* We don't have a "waiting locks list" on clients. */
00531                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Client lock %p : no-op\n", lock);
00532                 return 0;
00533         }
00534 
00535         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00536         ret = __ldlm_del_waiting_lock(lock);
00537         ldlm_clear_waited(lock);
00538         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00539 
00540         /* remove the lock out of export blocking list */
00541         spin_lock_bh(&lock->l_export->exp_bl_list_lock);
00542         list_del_init(&lock->l_exp_list);
00543         spin_unlock_bh(&lock->l_export->exp_bl_list_lock);
00544 
00545         if (ret) {
00546                 /* release lock ref if it has indeed been removed
00547                  * from a list */
00548                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00549         }
00550 
00551         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "%s", ret == 0 ? "wasn't waiting" : "removed");
00552         return ret;
00553 }
00554 
00560 int ldlm_refresh_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock, int timeout)
00561 {
00562         if (lock->l_export == NULL) {
00563                 /* We don't have a "waiting locks list" on clients. */
00564                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client lock: no-op");
00565                 return 0;
00566         }
00567 
00568         if (exp_connect_flags(lock->l_export) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) {
00569                 /* We don't have a "waiting locks list" on OSP. */
00570                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "MDS-MDS lock: no-op");
00571                 return 0;
00572         }
00573 
00574         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00575 
00576         if (list_empty(&lock->l_pending_chain)) {
00577                 spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00578                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "wasn't waiting");
00579                 return 0;
00580         }
00581 
00582         /* we remove/add the lock to the waiting list, so no needs to
00583          * release/take a lock reference */
00584         __ldlm_del_waiting_lock(lock);
00585         __ldlm_add_waiting_lock(lock, timeout);
00586         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00587 
00588         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "refreshed");
00589         return 1;
00590 }
00591 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_refresh_waiting_lock);
00592

00595 int ldlm_del_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00596 {
00597         RETURN(0);
00598 }
00599 
00600 int ldlm_refresh_waiting_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock, int timeout)
00601 {
00602         RETURN(0);
00603 }

00618 unsigned int ldlm_bl_timeout(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00619 {
00620         unsigned int timeout;
00621 
00622         if (AT_OFF)
00623                 return obd_timeout / 2;
00624 
00625         /* Since these are non-updating timeouts, we should be conservative.
00626          * Take more than usually, 150%
00627          * It would be nice to have some kind of "early reply" mechanism for
00628          * lock callbacks too... */
00629         timeout = at_get(&lock->l_export->exp_bl_lock_at);
00630         return max(timeout + (timeout >> 1), ldlm_enqueue_min);
00631 }
00632 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_bl_timeout);
00633 
00637 static void ldlm_failed_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, int rc,
00638                             const char *ast_type)
00639 {
00640         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x138, "%s: A client on nid %s was evicted due "
00641                            "to a lock %s callback time out: rc %d\n",
00642                            lock->l_export->exp_obd->obd_name,
00643                            obd_export_nid2str(lock->l_export), ast_type, rc);
00644 
00645         if (obd_dump_on_timeout)
00646                 libcfs_debug_dumplog();
00647         spin_lock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00648         if (__ldlm_del_waiting_lock(lock) == 0)
00649                 /* the lock was not in any list, grab an extra ref before adding
00650                  * the lock to the expired list */
00651                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
00652         list_add(&lock->l_pending_chain,
00653                      &expired_lock_thread.elt_expired_locks);
00654         wake_up(&expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq);
00655         spin_unlock_bh(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
00656 }
00657 
00661 static int ldlm_handle_ast_error(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00662                                  struct ptlrpc_request *req, int rc,
00663                                  const char *ast_type)
00664 {
00665         lnet_process_id_t peer = req->rq_import->imp_connection->c_peer;
00666 
00667         if (!req->rq_replied || (rc && rc != -EINVAL)) {
00668                 if (lock->l_export && lock->l_export->exp_libclient) {
00669                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "%s AST to liblustre client (nid %s)"
00670                                    " timeout, just cancelling lock", ast_type,
00671                                    libcfs_nid2str(peer.nid));
00672                         ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
00673                         rc = -ERESTART;
00674                 } else if (ldlm_is_cancel(lock)) {
00675                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "%s AST timeout from nid %s, but "
00676                                    "cancel was received (AST reply lost?)",
00677                                    ast_type, libcfs_nid2str(peer.nid));
00678                         ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
00679                         rc = -ERESTART;
00680                 } else {
00681                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "client (nid %s) %s %s AST "
00682                                    "(req status %d rc %d), evict it",
00683                                    libcfs_nid2str(peer.nid),
00684                                    req->rq_replied ? "returned error from" :
00685                                    "failed to reply to",
00686                                    ast_type,
00687                                    (req->rq_repmsg != NULL) ?
00688                                    lustre_msg_get_status(req->rq_repmsg) : 0,
00689                                    rc);
00690                         ldlm_failed_ast(lock, rc, ast_type);
00691                 }
00692                 return rc;
00693         }
00694 
00695         if (rc == -EINVAL) {
00696                 struct ldlm_resource *res = lock->l_resource;
00697 
00698                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client (nid %s) returned %d"
00699                            " from %s AST - normal race",
00700                            libcfs_nid2str(peer.nid),
00701                            req->rq_repmsg ?
00702                            lustre_msg_get_status(req->rq_repmsg) : -1,
00703                            ast_type);
00704                 if (res) {
00705                         /* update lvbo to return proper attributes.
00706                          * see bug 23174 */
00707                         ldlm_resource_getref(res);
00708                         ldlm_res_lvbo_update(res, NULL, 1);
00709                         ldlm_resource_putref(res);
00710                 }
00711                 ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
00712                 rc = -ERESTART;
00713         }
00714 
00715         return rc;
00716 }
00717 
00718 static int ldlm_cb_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00719                              struct ptlrpc_request *req, void *data, int rc)
00720 {
00721         struct ldlm_cb_async_args *ca   = data;
00722         struct ldlm_lock          *lock = ca->ca_lock;
00723         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg    *arg  = ca->ca_set_arg;
00724         ENTRY;
00725 
00726         LASSERT(lock != NULL);
00727 
00728         switch (arg->type) {
00729         case LDLM_GL_CALLBACK:
00730                 /* Update the LVB from disk if the AST failed
00731                  * (this is a legal race)
00732                  *
00733                  * - Glimpse callback of local lock just returns
00734                  *   -ELDLM_NO_LOCK_DATA.
00735                  * - Glimpse callback of remote lock might return
00736                  *   -ELDLM_NO_LOCK_DATA when inode is cleared. LU-274
00737                  */
00738                 if (rc == -ELDLM_NO_LOCK_DATA) {
00739                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "lost race - client has a lock but no "
00740                                    "inode");
00741                         ldlm_res_lvbo_update(lock->l_resource, NULL, 1);
00742                 } else if (rc != 0) {
00743                         rc = ldlm_handle_ast_error(lock, req, rc, "glimpse");
00744                 } else {
00745                         rc = ldlm_res_lvbo_update(lock->l_resource, req, 1);
00746                 }
00747                 break;
00748         case LDLM_BL_CALLBACK:
00749                 if (rc != 0)
00750                         rc = ldlm_handle_ast_error(lock, req, rc, "blocking");
00751                 break;
00752         case LDLM_CP_CALLBACK:
00753                 if (rc != 0)
00754                         rc = ldlm_handle_ast_error(lock, req, rc, "completion");
00755                 break;
00756         default:
00757                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "invalid opcode for lock callback %d",
00758                            arg->type);
00759                 LBUG();
00760         }
00761 
00762         /* release extra reference taken in ldlm_ast_fini() */
00763         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
00764 
00765         if (rc == -ERESTART)
00766                 atomic_inc(&arg->restart);
00767 
00768         RETURN(0);
00769 }
00770 
00771 static void ldlm_update_resend(struct ptlrpc_request *req, void *data)
00772 {
00773         struct ldlm_cb_async_args *ca   = data;
00774         struct ldlm_lock          *lock = ca->ca_lock;
00775 
00776         ldlm_refresh_waiting_lock(lock, ldlm_bl_timeout(lock));
00777 }
00778 
00779 static inline int ldlm_ast_fini(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00780                                 struct ldlm_cb_set_arg *arg,
00781                                 struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00782                                 int instant_cancel)
00783 {
00784         int rc = 0;
00785         ENTRY;
00786 
00787         if (unlikely(instant_cancel)) {
00788                 rc = ptl_send_rpc(req, 1);
00789                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00790                 if (rc == 0)
00791                         atomic_inc(&arg->restart);
00792         } else {
00793                 LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
00794                 ptlrpc_set_add_req(arg->set, req);
00795         }
00796 
00797         RETURN(rc);
00798 }
00799 
00804 static void ldlm_lock_reorder_req(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00805 {
00806         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00807         ENTRY;
00808 
00809         if (lock->l_export == NULL) {
00810                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client lock: no-op");
00811                 RETURN_EXIT;
00812         }
00813 
00814         spin_lock_bh(&lock->l_export->exp_rpc_lock);
00815         list_for_each_entry(req, &lock->l_export->exp_hp_rpcs,
00816                             rq_exp_list) {
00817                 /* Do not process requests that were not yet added to there
00818                  * incoming queue or were already removed from there for
00819                  * processing. We evaluate ptlrpc_nrs_req_can_move() without
00820                  * holding svcpt->scp_req_lock, and then redo the check with
00821                  * the lock held once we need to obtain a reliable result.
00822                  */
00823                 if (ptlrpc_nrs_req_can_move(req) &&
00824                     req->rq_ops->hpreq_lock_match &&
00825                     req->rq_ops->hpreq_lock_match(req, lock))
00826                         ptlrpc_nrs_req_hp_move(req);
00827         }
00828         spin_unlock_bh(&lock->l_export->exp_rpc_lock);
00829         EXIT;
00830 }
00831 
00839 int ldlm_server_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00840                              struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc,
00841                              void *data, int flag)
00842 {
00843         struct ldlm_cb_async_args *ca;
00844         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg *arg = data;
00845         struct ldlm_request    *body;
00846         struct ptlrpc_request  *req;
00847         int                     instant_cancel = 0;
00848         int                     rc = 0;
00849         ENTRY;
00850 
00851         if (flag == LDLM_CB_CANCELING)
00852                 /* Don't need to do anything here. */
00853                 RETURN(0);
00854 
00855         LASSERT(lock);
00856         LASSERT(data != NULL);
00857         if (lock->l_export->exp_obd->obd_recovering != 0)
00858                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "BUG 6063: lock collide during recovery");
00859 
00860         ldlm_lock_reorder_req(lock);
00861 
00862         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(lock->l_export->exp_imp_reverse,
00863                                         &RQF_LDLM_BL_CALLBACK,
00864                                         LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION, LDLM_BL_CALLBACK);
00865         if (req == NULL)
00866                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00867 
00868         CLASSERT(sizeof(*ca) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
00869         ca = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00870         ca->ca_set_arg = arg;
00871         ca->ca_lock = lock;
00872 
00873         req->rq_interpret_reply = ldlm_cb_interpret;
00874 
00875         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00876         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock)) {
00877                 /* What's the point? */
00878                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00879                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00880                 RETURN(0);
00881         }
00882 
00883         if (lock->l_granted_mode != lock->l_req_mode) {
00884                 /* this blocking AST will be communicated as part of the
00885                  * completion AST instead */
00886                 ldlm_add_blocked_lock(lock);
00887                 ldlm_set_waited(lock);
00888                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00889 
00890                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00891                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "lock not granted, not sending blocking AST");
00892                 RETURN(0);
00893         }
00894 
00895         if (ldlm_is_cancel_on_block(lock))
00896                 instant_cancel = 1;
00897 
00898         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
00899         body->lock_handle[0] = lock->l_remote_handle;
00900         body->lock_desc = *desc;
00901         body->lock_flags |= ldlm_flags_to_wire(lock->l_flags & LDLM_FL_AST_MASK);
00902 
00903         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server preparing blocking AST");
00904 
00905         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00906         ldlm_set_cbpending(lock);
00907         if (instant_cancel) {
00908                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00909                 ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
00910 
00911                 req->rq_no_resend = 1;
00912         } else {
00913                 LASSERT(lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode);
00914                 ldlm_add_waiting_lock(lock);
00915                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00916 
00917                 /* Do not resend after lock callback timeout */
00918                 req->rq_delay_limit = ldlm_bl_timeout(lock);
00919                 req->rq_resend_cb = ldlm_update_resend;
00920         }
00921 
00922         req->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_FULL;
00923         /* ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack already set timeout */
00924         if (AT_OFF)
00925                 req->rq_timeout = ldlm_get_rq_timeout();
00926 
00927         lock->l_last_activity = cfs_time_current_sec();
00928 
00929         if (lock->l_export && lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats &&
00930             lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats)
00931                 lprocfs_counter_incr(lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats,
00932                                      LDLM_BL_CALLBACK - LDLM_FIRST_OPC);
00933 
00934         rc = ldlm_ast_fini(req, arg, lock, instant_cancel);
00935 
00936         RETURN(rc);
00937 }
00938 
00946 int ldlm_server_completion_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 flags, void *data)
00947 {
00948         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg *arg = data;
00949         struct ldlm_request    *body;
00950         struct ptlrpc_request  *req;
00951         struct ldlm_cb_async_args *ca;
00952         int                     instant_cancel = 0;
00953         int                     rc = 0;
00954         int                     lvb_len;
00955         ENTRY;
00956 
00957         LASSERT(lock != NULL);
00958         LASSERT(data != NULL);
00959 
00960         if (OBD_FAIL_PRECHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_SRV_CP_AST)) {
00961                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "dropping CP AST");
00962                 RETURN(0);
00963         }
00964 
00965         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(lock->l_export->exp_imp_reverse,
00966                                     &RQF_LDLM_CP_CALLBACK);
00967         if (req == NULL)
00968                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00969 
00970         /* server namespace, doesn't need lock */
00971         lvb_len = ldlm_lvbo_size(lock);
00972         /* LU-3124 & LU-2187: to not return layout in completion AST because
00973          * it may deadlock for LU-2187, or client may not have enough space
00974          * for large layout. The layout will be returned to client with an
00975          * extra RPC to fetch xattr.lov */
00976         if (ldlm_has_layout(lock))
00977                 lvb_len = 0;
00978 
00979         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_CLIENT, lvb_len);
00980         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION, LDLM_CP_CALLBACK);
00981         if (rc) {
00982                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00983                 RETURN(rc);
00984         }
00985 
00986         CLASSERT(sizeof(*ca) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
00987         ca = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00988         ca->ca_set_arg = arg;
00989         ca->ca_lock = lock;
00990 
00991         req->rq_interpret_reply = ldlm_cb_interpret;
00992         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
00993 
00994         body->lock_handle[0] = lock->l_remote_handle;
00995         body->lock_flags = ldlm_flags_to_wire(flags);
00996         ldlm_lock2desc(lock, &body->lock_desc);
00997         if (lvb_len > 0) {
00998                 void *lvb = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB);
00999 
01000                 lvb_len = ldlm_lvbo_fill(lock, lvb, lvb_len);
01001                 if (lvb_len < 0) {
01002                         /* We still need to send the RPC to wake up the blocked
01003                          * enqueue thread on the client.
01004                          *
01005                          * Consider old client, there is no better way to notify
01006                          * the failure, just zero-sized the LVB, then the client
01007                          * will fail out as "-EPROTO". */
01008                         req_capsule_shrink(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, 0,
01009                                            RCL_CLIENT);
01010                         instant_cancel = 1;
01011                 } else {
01012                         req_capsule_shrink(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, lvb_len,
01013                                            RCL_CLIENT);
01014                 }
01015         }
01016 
01017         lock->l_last_activity = cfs_time_current_sec();
01018 
01019         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server preparing completion AST");
01020 
01021         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01022 
01023         req->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_FULL;
01024         /* ptlrpc_request_pack already set timeout */
01025         if (AT_OFF)
01026                 req->rq_timeout = ldlm_get_rq_timeout();
01027 
01028         /* We only send real blocking ASTs after the lock is granted */
01029         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01030         if (ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock)) {
01031                 body->lock_flags |= ldlm_flags_to_wire(LDLM_FL_AST_SENT);
01032                 /* Copy AST flags like LDLM_FL_DISCARD_DATA. */
01033                 body->lock_flags |= ldlm_flags_to_wire(lock->l_flags &
01034                                                        LDLM_FL_AST_MASK);
01035 
01036                 /* We might get here prior to ldlm_handle_enqueue setting
01037                  * LDLM_FL_CANCEL_ON_BLOCK flag. Then we will put this lock
01038                  * into waiting list, but this is safe and similar code in
01039                  * ldlm_handle_enqueue will call ldlm_lock_cancel() still,
01040                  * that would not only cancel the lock, but will also remove
01041                  * it from waiting list */
01042                 if (ldlm_is_cancel_on_block(lock)) {
01043                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01044                         ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
01045 
01046                         instant_cancel = 1;
01047                         req->rq_no_resend = 1;
01048 
01049                         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01050                 } else {
01051                         /* start the lock-timeout clock */
01052                         ldlm_add_waiting_lock(lock);
01053                         /* Do not resend after lock callback timeout */
01054                         req->rq_delay_limit = ldlm_bl_timeout(lock);
01055                         req->rq_resend_cb = ldlm_update_resend;
01056                 }
01057         }
01058         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01059 
01060         if (lock->l_export && lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats &&
01061             lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats)
01062                 lprocfs_counter_incr(lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats,
01063                                      LDLM_CP_CALLBACK - LDLM_FIRST_OPC);
01064 
01065         rc = ldlm_ast_fini(req, arg, lock, instant_cancel);
01066 
01067         RETURN(lvb_len < 0 ? lvb_len : rc);
01068 }
01069 
01076 int ldlm_server_glimpse_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *data)
01077 {
01078         struct ldlm_cb_set_arg          *arg = data;
01079         struct ldlm_request             *body;
01080         struct ptlrpc_request           *req;
01081         struct ldlm_cb_async_args       *ca;
01082         int                              rc;
01083         struct req_format               *req_fmt;
01084         ENTRY;
01085 
01086         LASSERT(lock != NULL);
01087 
01088         if (arg->gl_desc != NULL)
01089                 /* There is a glimpse descriptor to pack */
01090                 req_fmt = &RQF_LDLM_GL_DESC_CALLBACK;
01091         else
01092                 req_fmt = &RQF_LDLM_GL_CALLBACK;
01093 
01094         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(lock->l_export->exp_imp_reverse,
01095                                         req_fmt, LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION,
01096                                         LDLM_GL_CALLBACK);
01097 
01098         if (req == NULL)
01099                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01100 
01101         if (arg->gl_desc != NULL) {
01102                 /* copy the GL descriptor */
01103                 union ldlm_gl_desc      *desc;
01104                 desc = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_GL_DESC);
01105                 *desc = *arg->gl_desc;
01106         }
01107 
01108         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
01109         body->lock_handle[0] = lock->l_remote_handle;
01110         ldlm_lock2desc(lock, &body->lock_desc);
01111 
01112         CLASSERT(sizeof(*ca) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
01113         ca = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
01114         ca->ca_set_arg = arg;
01115         ca->ca_lock = lock;
01116 
01117         /* server namespace, doesn't need lock */
01118         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER,
01119                              ldlm_lvbo_size(lock));
01120         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01121 
01122         req->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_FULL;
01123         /* ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack already set timeout */
01124         if (AT_OFF)
01125                 req->rq_timeout = ldlm_get_rq_timeout();
01126 
01127         lock->l_last_activity = cfs_time_current_sec();
01128 
01129         req->rq_interpret_reply = ldlm_cb_interpret;
01130 
01131         if (lock->l_export && lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats &&
01132             lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats)
01133                 lprocfs_counter_incr(lock->l_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats,
01134                                      LDLM_GL_CALLBACK - LDLM_FIRST_OPC);
01135 
01136         rc = ldlm_ast_fini(req, arg, lock, 0);
01137 
01138         RETURN(rc);
01139 }
01140 
01141 int ldlm_glimpse_locks(struct ldlm_resource *res,
01142                        struct list_head *gl_work_list)
01143 {
01144         int     rc;
01145         ENTRY;
01146 
01147         rc = ldlm_run_ast_work(ldlm_res_to_ns(res), gl_work_list,
01148                                LDLM_WORK_GL_AST);
01149         if (rc == -ERESTART)
01150                 ldlm_reprocess_all(res);
01151 
01152         RETURN(rc);
01153 }
01154 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_glimpse_locks);
01155 
01156 /* return LDLM lock associated with a lock callback request */
01157 struct ldlm_lock *ldlm_request_lock(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01158 {
01159         struct ldlm_cb_async_args       *ca;
01160         struct ldlm_lock                *lock;
01161         ENTRY;
01162 
01163         ca = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
01164         lock = ca->ca_lock;
01165         if (lock == NULL)
01166                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EFAULT));
01167 
01168         RETURN(lock);
01169 }
01170 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_request_lock);
01171 
01172 static void ldlm_svc_get_eopc(const struct ldlm_request *dlm_req,
01173                        struct lprocfs_stats *srv_stats)
01174 {
01175         int lock_type = 0, op = 0;
01176 
01177         lock_type = dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type;
01178 
01179         switch (lock_type) {
01180         case LDLM_PLAIN:
01181                 op = PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR + LDLM_PLAIN_ENQUEUE;
01182                 break;
01183         case LDLM_EXTENT:
01184                 if (dlm_req->lock_flags & LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT)
01185                         op = PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR + LDLM_GLIMPSE_ENQUEUE;
01186                 else
01187                         op = PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR + LDLM_EXTENT_ENQUEUE;
01188                 break;
01189         case LDLM_FLOCK:
01190                 op = PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR + LDLM_FLOCK_ENQUEUE;
01191                 break;
01192         case LDLM_IBITS:
01193                 op = PTLRPC_LAST_CNTR + LDLM_IBITS_ENQUEUE;
01194                 break;
01195         default:
01196                 op = 0;
01197                 break;
01198         }
01199 
01200         if (op)
01201                 lprocfs_counter_incr(srv_stats, op);
01202 
01203         return;
01204 }
01205 
01210 int ldlm_handle_enqueue0(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01211                          struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01212                          const struct ldlm_request *dlm_req,
01213                          const struct ldlm_callback_suite *cbs)
01214 {
01215         struct ldlm_reply *dlm_rep;
01216         __u64 flags;
01217         enum ldlm_error err = ELDLM_OK;
01218         struct ldlm_lock *lock = NULL;
01219         void *cookie = NULL;
01220         int rc = 0;
01221         struct ldlm_resource *res = NULL;
01222         ENTRY;
01223 
01224         LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("server-side enqueue handler START");
01225 
01226         ldlm_request_cancel(req, dlm_req, LDLM_ENQUEUE_CANCEL_OFF, LATF_SKIP);
01227         flags = ldlm_flags_from_wire(dlm_req->lock_flags);
01228 
01229         LASSERT(req->rq_export);
01230 
01231         if (ptlrpc_req2svc(req)->srv_stats != NULL)
01232                 ldlm_svc_get_eopc(dlm_req, ptlrpc_req2svc(req)->srv_stats);
01233 
01234         if (req->rq_export && req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats &&
01235             req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats)
01236                 lprocfs_counter_incr(req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats,
01237                                      LDLM_ENQUEUE - LDLM_FIRST_OPC);
01238 
01239         if (unlikely(dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type < LDLM_MIN_TYPE ||
01240                      dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type >= LDLM_MAX_TYPE)) {
01241                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "invalid lock request type %d",
01242                           dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type);
01243                 GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
01244         }
01245 
01246         if (unlikely(dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode <= LCK_MINMODE ||
01247                      dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode >= LCK_MAXMODE ||
01248                      dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode &
01249                      (dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode-1))) {
01250                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "invalid lock request mode %d",
01251                           dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode);
01252                 GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
01253         }
01254 
01255         if (exp_connect_flags(req->rq_export) & OBD_CONNECT_IBITS) {
01256                 if (unlikely(dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type ==
01257                              LDLM_PLAIN)) {
01258                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req,
01259                                   "PLAIN lock request from IBITS client?");
01260                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01261                 }
01262         } else if (unlikely(dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type ==
01263                             LDLM_IBITS)) {
01264                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req,
01265                           "IBITS lock request from unaware client?");
01266                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01267         }
01268 
01269 #if 0
01270         /* FIXME this makes it impossible to use LDLM_PLAIN locks -- check
01271            against server's _CONNECT_SUPPORTED flags? (I don't want to use
01272            ibits for mgc/mgs) */
01273 
01274         /* INODEBITS_INTEROP: Perform conversion from plain lock to
01275          * inodebits lock if client does not support them. */
01276         if (!(exp_connect_flags(req->rq_export) & OBD_CONNECT_IBITS) &&
01277             (dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type == LDLM_PLAIN)) {
01278                 dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type = LDLM_IBITS;
01279                 dlm_req->lock_desc.l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits =
01280                         MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP | MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE;
01281                 if (dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode == LCK_PR)
01282                         dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode = LCK_CR;
01283         }
01284 #endif
01285 
01286         if (unlikely((flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY) ||
01287                      (lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_RESENT))) {
01288                 /* Find an existing lock in the per-export lock hash */
01289                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
01290                  * ldlm_export_lock_keycmp() */
01291                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
01292                 lock = cfs_hash_lookup(req->rq_export->exp_lock_hash,
01293                                        (void *)&dlm_req->lock_handle[0]);
01294                 if (lock != NULL) {
01295                         DEBUG_REQ(D_DLMTRACE, req, "found existing lock cookie "
01296                                   LPX64, lock->l_handle.h_cookie);
01297                         flags |= LDLM_FL_RESENT;
01298                         GOTO(existing_lock, rc = 0);
01299                 }
01300         } else {
01301                 if (ldlm_reclaim_full()) {
01302                         DEBUG_REQ(D_DLMTRACE, req, "Too many granted locks, "
01303                                   "reject current enqueue request and let the "
01304                                   "client retry later.\n");
01305                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINPROGRESS);
01306                 }
01307         }
01308 
01309         /* The lock's callback data might be set in the policy function */
01310         lock = ldlm_lock_create(ns, &dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_name,
01311                                 dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type,
01312                                 dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode,
01313                                 cbs, NULL, 0, LVB_T_NONE);
01314         if (IS_ERR(lock)) {
01315                 rc = PTR_ERR(lock);
01316                 lock = NULL;
01317                 GOTO(out, rc);
01318         }
01319 
01320         lock->l_remote_handle = dlm_req->lock_handle[0];
01321         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server-side enqueue handler, new lock created");
01322 
01323         /* Initialize resource lvb but not for a lock being replayed since
01324          * Client already got lvb sent in this case.
01325          * This must occur early since some policy methods assume resource
01326          * lvb is available (lr_lvb_data != NULL).
01327          */
01328         res = lock->l_resource;
01329         if (!(flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY)) {
01330                 /* non-replayed lock, delayed lvb init may need to be done */
01331                 rc = ldlm_lvbo_init(res);
01332                 if (rc < 0) {
01333                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "delayed lvb init failed (rc %d)", rc);
01334                         GOTO(out, rc);
01335                 }
01336         }
01337 
01338         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_ENQUEUE_BLOCKED, obd_timeout * 2);
01339         /* Don't enqueue a lock onto the export if it is been disonnected
01340          * due to eviction (bug 3822) or server umount (bug 24324).
01341          * Cancel it now instead. */
01342         if (req->rq_export->exp_disconnected) {
01343                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock on disconnected export %p",
01344                            req->rq_export);
01345                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
01346         }
01347 
01348         lock->l_export = class_export_lock_get(req->rq_export, lock);
01349         if (lock->l_export->exp_lock_hash)
01350                 cfs_hash_add(lock->l_export->exp_lock_hash,
01351                              &lock->l_remote_handle,
01352                              &lock->l_exp_hash);
01353 
01354         /* Inherit the enqueue flags before the operation, because we do not
01355          * keep the res lock on return and next operations (BL AST) may proceed
01356          * without them. */
01357         lock->l_flags |= ldlm_flags_from_wire(dlm_req->lock_flags &
01358                                               LDLM_FL_INHERIT_MASK);
01359 existing_lock:
01360 
01361         if (flags & LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT) {
01362                 /* In this case, the reply buffer is allocated deep in
01363                  * local_lock_enqueue by the policy function. */
01364                 cookie = req;
01365         } else {
01366                 /* based on the assumption that lvb size never changes during
01367                  * resource life time otherwise it need resource->lr_lock's
01368                  * protection */
01369                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01370                                      RCL_SERVER, ldlm_lvbo_size(lock));
01371 
01372                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_ENQUEUE_EXTENT_ERR))
01373                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01374 
01375                 rc = req_capsule_server_pack(&req->rq_pill);
01376                 if (rc)
01377                         GOTO(out, rc);
01378         }
01379 
01380         if (dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type != LDLM_PLAIN)
01381                 ldlm_convert_policy_to_local(req->rq_export,
01382                                           dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type,
01383                                           &dlm_req->lock_desc.l_policy_data,
01384                                           &lock->l_policy_data);
01385         if (dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT)
01386                 lock->l_req_extent = lock->l_policy_data.l_extent;
01387 
01388         err = ldlm_lock_enqueue(ns, &lock, cookie, &flags);
01389         if (err) {
01390                 if ((int)err < 0)
01391                         rc = (int)err;
01392                 GOTO(out, err);
01393         }
01394 
01395         dlm_rep = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
01396 
01397         ldlm_lock2desc(lock, &dlm_rep->lock_desc);
01398         ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &dlm_rep->lock_handle);
01399 
01400         if (lock && lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT)
01401                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_BL_EVICT, 6);
01402 
01403         /* We never send a blocking AST until the lock is granted, but
01404          * we can tell it right now */
01405         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01406 
01407         /* Now take into account flags to be inherited from original lock
01408            request both in reply to client and in our own lock flags. */
01409         dlm_rep->lock_flags = ldlm_flags_to_wire(flags);
01410         lock->l_flags |= flags & LDLM_FL_INHERIT_MASK;
01411 
01412         /* Don't move a pending lock onto the export if it has already been
01413          * disconnected due to eviction (bug 5683) or server umount (bug 24324).
01414          * Cancel it now instead. */
01415         if (unlikely(req->rq_export->exp_disconnected ||
01416                      OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_ENQUEUE_OLD_EXPORT))) {
01417                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock on destroyed export %p", req->rq_export);
01418                 rc = -ENOTCONN;
01419         } else if (ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock)) {
01420                 dlm_rep->lock_flags |= ldlm_flags_to_wire(LDLM_FL_AST_SENT);
01421                 if (lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode) {
01422                         /*
01423                          * Only cancel lock if it was granted, because it would
01424                          * be destroyed immediately and would never be granted
01425                          * in the future, causing timeouts on client.  Not
01426                          * granted lock will be cancelled immediately after
01427                          * sending completion AST.
01428                          */
01429                         if (dlm_rep->lock_flags & LDLM_FL_CANCEL_ON_BLOCK) {
01430                                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01431                                 ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
01432                                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01433                         } else
01434                                 ldlm_add_waiting_lock(lock);
01435                 }
01436         }
01437         /* Make sure we never ever grant usual metadata locks to liblustre
01438            clients */
01439         if ((dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type == LDLM_PLAIN ||
01440             dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type == LDLM_IBITS) &&
01441              req->rq_export->exp_libclient) {
01442                 if (unlikely(!ldlm_is_cancel_on_block(lock) ||
01443                              !(dlm_rep->lock_flags & LDLM_FL_CANCEL_ON_BLOCK))){
01444                         CERROR("Granting sync lock to libclient. "
01445                                "req fl %d, rep fl %d, lock fl "LPX64"\n",
01446                                dlm_req->lock_flags, dlm_rep->lock_flags,
01447                                lock->l_flags);
01448                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "sync lock");
01449                         if (dlm_req->lock_flags & LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT) {
01450                                 struct ldlm_intent *it;
01451 
01452                                 it = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill,
01453                                                             &RMF_LDLM_INTENT);
01454                                 if (it != NULL) {
01455                                         CERROR("This is intent %s ("LPU64")\n",
01456                                                ldlm_it2str(it->opc), it->opc);
01457                                 }
01458                         }
01459                 }
01460         }
01461 
01462         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01463 
01464         EXIT;
01465  out:
01466         req->rq_status = rc ?: err; /* return either error - bug 11190 */
01467         if (!req->rq_packed_final) {
01468                 err = lustre_pack_reply(req, 1, NULL, NULL);
01469                 if (rc == 0)
01470                         rc = err;
01471         }
01472 
01473         /* The LOCK_CHANGED code in ldlm_lock_enqueue depends on this
01474          * ldlm_reprocess_all.  If this moves, revisit that code. -phil */
01475         if (lock != NULL) {
01476                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server-side enqueue handler, sending reply"
01477                            "(err=%d, rc=%d)", err, rc);
01478 
01479                 if (rc == 0) {
01480                         if (req_capsule_has_field(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01481                                                   RCL_SERVER) &&
01482                             ldlm_lvbo_size(lock) > 0) {
01483                                 void *buf;
01484                                 int buflen;
01485 
01486                                 buf = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill,
01487                                                              &RMF_DLM_LVB);
01488                                 LASSERTF(buf != NULL, "req %p, lock %p\n",
01489                                          req, lock);
01490                                 buflen = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill,
01491                                                 &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER);
01492                                 /* non-replayed lock, delayed lvb init may
01493                                  * need to be occur now */
01494                                 if ((buflen > 0) && !(flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY)) {
01495                                         buflen = ldlm_lvbo_fill(lock, buf,
01496                                                                 buflen);
01497                                         if (buflen >= 0)
01498                                                 req_capsule_shrink(
01499                                                         &req->rq_pill,
01500                                                         &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01501                                                         buflen, RCL_SERVER);
01502                                         else
01503                                                 rc = buflen;
01504                                 } else if (flags & LDLM_FL_REPLAY) {
01505                                         /* no LVB resend upon replay */
01506                                         if (buflen > 0)
01507                                                 req_capsule_shrink(
01508                                                         &req->rq_pill,
01509                                                         &RMF_DLM_LVB,
01510                                                         0, RCL_SERVER);
01511                                         else
01512                                                 rc = buflen;
01513                                 } else {
01514                                         rc = buflen;
01515                                 }
01516                         }
01517                 }
01518 
01519                 if (rc != 0 && !(flags & LDLM_FL_RESENT)) {
01520                         if (lock->l_export) {
01521                                 ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
01522                         } else {
01523                                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01524                                 ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
01525                                 ldlm_lock_destroy_nolock(lock);
01526                                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01527 
01528                         }
01529                 }
01530 
01531                 if (!err && dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type != LDLM_FLOCK)
01532                         ldlm_reprocess_all(lock->l_resource);
01533 
01534                 LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01535         }
01536 
01537         LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("server-side enqueue handler END (lock %p, rc %d)",
01538                           lock, rc);
01539 
01540         return rc;
01541 }
01542 
01546 int ldlm_handle_enqueue(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01547                         ldlm_completion_callback completion_callback,
01548                         ldlm_blocking_callback blocking_callback,
01549                         ldlm_glimpse_callback glimpse_callback)
01550 {
01551         struct ldlm_request *dlm_req;
01552         struct ldlm_callback_suite cbs = {
01553                 .lcs_completion = completion_callback,
01554                 .lcs_blocking   = blocking_callback,
01555                 .lcs_glimpse    = glimpse_callback
01556         };
01557         int rc;
01558 
01559         dlm_req = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
01560         if (dlm_req != NULL) {
01561                 rc = ldlm_handle_enqueue0(req->rq_export->exp_obd->obd_namespace,
01562                                           req, dlm_req, &cbs);
01563         } else {
01564                 rc = -EFAULT;
01565         }
01566         return rc;
01567 }
01568 
01572 int ldlm_handle_convert0(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01573                          const struct ldlm_request *dlm_req)
01574 {
01575         struct ldlm_reply *dlm_rep;
01576         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01577         int rc;
01578         ENTRY;
01579 
01580         if (req->rq_export && req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats &&
01581             req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats)
01582                 lprocfs_counter_incr(req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats,
01583                                      LDLM_CONVERT - LDLM_FIRST_OPC);
01584 
01585         rc = req_capsule_server_pack(&req->rq_pill);
01586         if (rc)
01587                 RETURN(rc);
01588 
01589         dlm_rep = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
01590         dlm_rep->lock_flags = dlm_req->lock_flags;
01591 
01592         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(&dlm_req->lock_handle[0]);
01593         if (!lock) {
01594                 req->rq_status = LUSTRE_EINVAL;
01595         } else {
01596                 void *res = NULL;
01597 
01598                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server-side convert handler START");
01599 
01600                 res = ldlm_lock_convert(lock, dlm_req->lock_desc.l_req_mode,
01601                                         &dlm_rep->lock_flags);
01602                 if (res) {
01603                         if (ldlm_del_waiting_lock(lock))
01604                                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "converted waiting lock");
01605                         req->rq_status = 0;
01606                 } else {
01607                         req->rq_status = LUSTRE_EDEADLK;
01608                 }
01609         }
01610 
01611         if (lock) {
01612                 if (!req->rq_status)
01613                         ldlm_reprocess_all(lock->l_resource);
01614                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server-side convert handler END");
01615                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
01616         } else
01617                 LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("server-side convert handler END");
01618 
01619         RETURN(0);
01620 }
01621 
01626 int ldlm_handle_convert(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01627 {
01628         int rc;
01629         struct ldlm_request *dlm_req;
01630 
01631         dlm_req = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
01632         if (dlm_req != NULL) {
01633                 rc = ldlm_handle_convert0(req, dlm_req);
01634         } else {
01635                 CERROR ("Can't unpack dlm_req\n");
01636                 rc = -EFAULT;
01637         }
01638         return rc;
01639 }
01640 
01647 int ldlm_request_cancel(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01648                         const struct ldlm_request *dlm_req,
01649                         int first, enum lustre_at_flags flags)
01650 {
01651         struct ldlm_resource *res, *pres = NULL;
01652         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01653         int i, count, done = 0;
01654         ENTRY;
01655 
01656         count = dlm_req->lock_count ? dlm_req->lock_count : 1;
01657         if (first >= count)
01658                 RETURN(0);
01659 
01660         if (count == 1 && dlm_req->lock_handle[0].cookie == 0)
01661                 RETURN(0);
01662 
01663         /* There is no lock on the server at the replay time,
01664          * skip lock cancelling to make replay tests to pass. */
01665         if (lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REPLAY)
01666                 RETURN(0);
01667 
01668         LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("server-side cancel handler START: %d locks, "
01669                           "starting at %d", count, first);
01670 
01671         for (i = first; i < count; i++) {
01672                 lock = ldlm_handle2lock(&dlm_req->lock_handle[i]);
01673                 if (!lock) {
01674                         LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("server-side cancel handler stale "
01675                                           "lock (cookie "LPU64")",
01676                                           dlm_req->lock_handle[i].cookie);
01677                         continue;
01678                 }
01679 
01680                 res = lock->l_resource;
01681                 done++;
01682 
01683                 /* This code is an optimization to only attempt lock
01684                  * granting on the resource (that could be CPU-expensive)
01685                  * after we are done cancelling lock in that resource. */
01686                 if (res != pres) {
01687                         if (pres != NULL) {
01688                                 ldlm_reprocess_all(pres);
01689                                 LDLM_RESOURCE_DELREF(pres);
01690                                 ldlm_resource_putref(pres);
01691                         }
01692                         if (res != NULL) {
01693                                 ldlm_resource_getref(res);
01694                                 LDLM_RESOURCE_ADDREF(res);
01695                                 ldlm_res_lvbo_update(res, NULL, 1);
01696                         }
01697                         pres = res;
01698                 }
01699 
01700                 if ((flags & LATF_STATS) && ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock)) {
01701                         long delay = cfs_time_sub(cfs_time_current_sec(),
01702                                                   lock->l_last_activity);
01703                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "server cancels blocked lock after "
01704                                    CFS_DURATION_T"s", delay);
01705                         at_measured(&lock->l_export->exp_bl_lock_at, delay);
01706                 }
01707                 ldlm_lock_cancel(lock);
01708                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
01709         }
01710         if (pres != NULL) {
01711                 ldlm_reprocess_all(pres);
01712                 LDLM_RESOURCE_DELREF(pres);
01713                 ldlm_resource_putref(pres);
01714         }
01715         LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("server-side cancel handler END");
01716         RETURN(done);
01717 }
01718 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_request_cancel);
01719 
01725 int ldlm_handle_cancel(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01726 {
01727         struct ldlm_request *dlm_req;
01728         int rc;
01729         ENTRY;
01730 
01731         dlm_req = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
01732         if (dlm_req == NULL) {
01733                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "bad request buffer for cancel\n");
01734                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
01735         }
01736 
01737         if (req->rq_export && req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats &&
01738             req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats)
01739                 lprocfs_counter_incr(req->rq_export->exp_nid_stats->nid_ldlm_stats,
01740                                      LDLM_CANCEL - LDLM_FIRST_OPC);
01741 
01742         rc = req_capsule_server_pack(&req->rq_pill);
01743         if (rc)
01744                 RETURN(rc);
01745 
01746         if (!ldlm_request_cancel(req, dlm_req, 0, LATF_STATS))
01747                 req->rq_status = LUSTRE_ESTALE;
01748 
01749         RETURN(ptlrpc_reply(req));
01750 }
01751 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
01752 
01758 void ldlm_handle_bl_callback(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01759                              struct ldlm_lock_desc *ld, struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01760 {
01761         int do_ast;
01762         ENTRY;
01763 
01764         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client blocking AST callback handler");
01765 
01766         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01767         ldlm_set_cbpending(lock);
01768 
01769         if (ldlm_is_cancel_on_block(lock))
01770                 ldlm_set_cancel(lock);
01771 
01772         do_ast = (!lock->l_readers && !lock->l_writers);
01773         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01774 
01775         if (do_ast) {
01776                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Lock %p already unused, calling callback (%p)\n",
01777                        lock, lock->l_blocking_ast);
01778                 if (lock->l_blocking_ast != NULL)
01779                         lock->l_blocking_ast(lock, ld, lock->l_ast_data,
01780                                              LDLM_CB_BLOCKING);
01781         } else {
01782                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Lock %p is referenced, will be cancelled later\n",
01783                        lock);
01784         }
01785 
01786         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client blocking callback handler END");
01787         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01788         EXIT;
01789 }
01790 
01796 static void ldlm_handle_cp_callback(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01797                                     struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01798                                     struct ldlm_request *dlm_req,
01799                                     struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01800 {
01801         struct list_head ast_list;
01802         int lvb_len;
01803         int rc = 0;
01804         ENTRY;
01805 
01806         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client completion callback handler START");
01807 
01808         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ast_list);
01809         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CANCEL_BL_CB_RACE)) {
01810                 int to = cfs_time_seconds(1);
01811                 while (to > 0) {
01812                         set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
01813                         schedule_timeout(to);
01814                         if (lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode ||
01815                             ldlm_is_destroyed(lock))
01816                                 break;
01817                 }
01818         }
01819 
01820         lvb_len = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_CLIENT);
01821         if (lvb_len < 0) {
01822                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Fail to get lvb_len, rc = %d", lvb_len);
01823                 GOTO(out, rc = lvb_len);
01824         } else if (lvb_len > 0) {
01825                 if (lock->l_lvb_len > 0) {
01826                         /* for extent lock, lvb contains ost_lvb{}. */
01827                         LASSERT(lock->l_lvb_data != NULL);
01828 
01829                         if (unlikely(lock->l_lvb_len < lvb_len)) {
01830                                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Replied LVB is larger than "
01831                                            "expectation, expected = %d, "
01832                                            "replied = %d",
01833                                            lock->l_lvb_len, lvb_len);
01834                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01835                         }
01836                 }
01837         }
01838 
01839         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01840         if (ldlm_is_destroyed(lock) ||
01841             lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode) {
01842                 /* bug 11300: the lock has already been granted */
01843                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01844                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "Double grant race happened");
01845                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01846         }
01847 
01848         /* If we receive the completion AST before the actual enqueue returned,
01849          * then we might need to switch lock modes, resources, or extents. */
01850         if (dlm_req->lock_desc.l_granted_mode != lock->l_req_mode) {
01851                 lock->l_req_mode = dlm_req->lock_desc.l_granted_mode;
01852                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "completion AST, new lock mode");
01853         }
01854 
01855         if (lock->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_PLAIN) {
01856                 ldlm_convert_policy_to_local(req->rq_export,
01857                                           dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_type,
01858                                           &dlm_req->lock_desc.l_policy_data,
01859                                           &lock->l_policy_data);
01860                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "completion AST, new policy data");
01861         }
01862 
01863         ldlm_resource_unlink_lock(lock);
01864         if (memcmp(&dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_name,
01865                    &lock->l_resource->lr_name,
01866                    sizeof(lock->l_resource->lr_name)) != 0) {
01867                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01868                 rc = ldlm_lock_change_resource(ns, lock,
01869                                 &dlm_req->lock_desc.l_resource.lr_name);
01870                 if (rc < 0) {
01871                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "Failed to allocate resource");
01872                         GOTO(out, rc);
01873                 }
01874                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "completion AST, new resource");
01875                 CERROR("change resource!\n");
01876                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01877         }
01878 
01879         if (dlm_req->lock_flags & LDLM_FL_AST_SENT) {
01880                 /* BL_AST locks are not needed in LRU.
01881                  * Let ldlm_cancel_lru() be fast. */
01882                 ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru(lock);
01883                 lock->l_flags |= LDLM_FL_CBPENDING | LDLM_FL_BL_AST;
01884                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "completion AST includes blocking AST");
01885         }
01886 
01887         if (lock->l_lvb_len > 0) {
01888                 rc = ldlm_fill_lvb(lock, &req->rq_pill, RCL_CLIENT,
01889                                    lock->l_lvb_data, lvb_len);
01890                 if (rc < 0) {
01891                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01892                         GOTO(out, rc);
01893                 }
01894         }
01895 
01896         ldlm_grant_lock(lock, &ast_list);
01897         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01898 
01899         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "callback handler finished, about to run_ast_work");
01900 
01901         /* Let Enqueue to call osc_lock_upcall() and initialize
01902          * l_ast_data */
01903         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CP_ENQ_RACE, 2);
01904 
01905         ldlm_run_ast_work(ns, &ast_list, LDLM_WORK_CP_AST);
01906 
01907         LDLM_DEBUG_NOLOCK("client completion callback handler END (lock %p)",
01908                           lock);
01909         GOTO(out, rc);
01910 
01911 out:
01912         if (rc < 0) {
01913                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01914                 ldlm_set_failed(lock);
01915                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01916                 wake_up(&lock->l_waitq);
01917         }
01918         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01919 }
01920 
01928 static void ldlm_handle_gl_callback(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01929                                     struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
01930                                     struct ldlm_request *dlm_req,
01931                                     struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01932 {
01933         int rc = -ENOSYS;
01934         ENTRY;
01935 
01936         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "client glimpse AST callback handler");
01937 
01938         if (lock->l_glimpse_ast != NULL)
01939                 rc = lock->l_glimpse_ast(lock, req);
01940 
01941         if (req->rq_repmsg != NULL) {
01942                 ptlrpc_reply(req);
01943         } else {
01944                 req->rq_status = rc;
01945                 ptlrpc_error(req);
01946         }
01947 
01948         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01949         if (lock->l_granted_mode == LCK_PW &&
01950             !lock->l_readers && !lock->l_writers &&
01951             cfs_time_after(cfs_time_current(),
01952                            cfs_time_add(lock->l_last_used,
01953                                         cfs_time_seconds(10)))) {
01954                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01955                 if (ldlm_bl_to_thread_lock(ns, NULL, lock))
01956                         ldlm_handle_bl_callback(ns, NULL, lock);
01957 
01958                 EXIT;
01959                 return;
01960         }
01961         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01962         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
01963         EXIT;
01964 }
01965 
01966 static int ldlm_callback_reply(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int rc)
01967 {
01968         if (req->rq_no_reply)
01969                 return 0;
01970 
01971         req->rq_status = rc;
01972         if (!req->rq_packed_final) {
01973                 rc = lustre_pack_reply(req, 1, NULL, NULL);
01974                 if (rc)
01975                         return rc;
01976         }
01977         return ptlrpc_reply(req);
01978 }
01979 
01980 static int __ldlm_bl_to_thread(struct ldlm_bl_work_item *blwi,
01981                                enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags)
01982 {
01983         struct ldlm_bl_pool *blp = ldlm_state->ldlm_bl_pool;
01984         ENTRY;
01985 
01986         spin_lock(&blp->blp_lock);
01987         if (blwi->blwi_lock &&
01988             ldlm_is_discard_data(blwi->blwi_lock)) {
01989                 /* add LDLM_FL_DISCARD_DATA requests to the priority list */
01990                 list_add_tail(&blwi->blwi_entry, &blp->blp_prio_list);
01991         } else {
01992                 /* other blocking callbacks are added to the regular list */
