01993                 list_add_tail(&blwi->blwi_entry, &blp->blp_list);
01994         }
01995         spin_unlock(&blp->blp_lock);
01996 
01997         wake_up(&blp->blp_waitq);
01998 
01999         /* can not check blwi->blwi_flags as blwi could be already freed in
02000            LCF_ASYNC mode */
02001         if (!(cancel_flags & LCF_ASYNC))
02002                 wait_for_completion(&blwi->blwi_comp);
02003 
02004         RETURN(0);
02005 }
02006 
02007 static inline void init_blwi(struct ldlm_bl_work_item *blwi,
02008                              struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
02009                              struct ldlm_lock_desc *ld,
02010                              struct list_head *cancels, int count,
02011                              struct ldlm_lock *lock,
02012                              enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags)
02013 {
02014         init_completion(&blwi->blwi_comp);
02015         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&blwi->blwi_head);
02016 
02017         if (memory_pressure_get())
02018                 blwi->blwi_mem_pressure = 1;
02019 
02020         blwi->blwi_ns = ns;
02021         blwi->blwi_flags = cancel_flags;
02022         if (ld != NULL)
02023                 blwi->blwi_ld = *ld;
02024         if (count) {
02025                 list_add(&blwi->blwi_head, cancels);
02026                 list_del_init(cancels);
02027                 blwi->blwi_count = count;
02028         } else {
02029                 blwi->blwi_lock = lock;
02030         }
02031 }
02032 
02042 static int ldlm_bl_to_thread(struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
02043                              struct ldlm_lock_desc *ld,
02044                              struct ldlm_lock *lock,
02045                              struct list_head *cancels, int count,
02046                              enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags)
02047 {
02048         ENTRY;
02049 
02050         if (cancels && count == 0)
02051                 RETURN(0);
02052 
02053         if (cancel_flags & LCF_ASYNC) {
02054                 struct ldlm_bl_work_item *blwi;
02055 
02056                 OBD_ALLOC(blwi, sizeof(*blwi));
02057                 if (blwi == NULL)
02058                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02059                 init_blwi(blwi, ns, ld, cancels, count, lock, cancel_flags);
02060 
02061                 RETURN(__ldlm_bl_to_thread(blwi, cancel_flags));
02062         } else {
02063                 /* if it is synchronous call do minimum mem alloc, as it could
02064                  * be triggered from kernel shrinker
02065                  */
02066                 struct ldlm_bl_work_item blwi;
02067 
02068                 memset(&blwi, 0, sizeof(blwi));
02069                 init_blwi(&blwi, ns, ld, cancels, count, lock, cancel_flags);
02070                 RETURN(__ldlm_bl_to_thread(&blwi, cancel_flags));
02071         }
02072 }
02073 
02074 
02075 int ldlm_bl_to_thread_lock(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, struct ldlm_lock_desc *ld,
02076                            struct ldlm_lock *lock)
02077 {
02078         return ldlm_bl_to_thread(ns, ld, lock, NULL, 0, LCF_ASYNC);
02079 }
02080 
02081 int ldlm_bl_to_thread_list(struct ldlm_namespace *ns, struct ldlm_lock_desc *ld,
02082                            struct list_head *cancels, int count,
02083                            enum ldlm_cancel_flags cancel_flags)
02084 {
02085         return ldlm_bl_to_thread(ns, ld, NULL, cancels, count, cancel_flags);
02086 }
02087 
02088 int ldlm_bl_thread_wakeup(void)
02089 {
02090         wake_up(&ldlm_state->ldlm_bl_pool->blp_waitq);
02091         return 0;
02092 }
02093 
02094 /* Setinfo coming from Server (eg MDT) to Client (eg MDC)! */
02095 static int ldlm_handle_setinfo(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02096 {
02097         struct obd_device *obd = req->rq_export->exp_obd;
02098         char *key;
02099         void *val;
02100         int keylen, vallen;
02101         int rc = -ENOSYS;
02102         ENTRY;
02103 
02104         DEBUG_REQ(D_HSM, req, "%s: handle setinfo\n", obd->obd_name);
02105 
02106         req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_OBD_SET_INFO);
02107 
02108         key = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_KEY);
02109         if (key == NULL) {
02110                 DEBUG_REQ(D_IOCTL, req, "no set_info key");
02111                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
02112         }
02113         keylen = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_KEY,
02114                                       RCL_CLIENT);
02115         val = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_VAL);
02116         if (val == NULL) {
02117                 DEBUG_REQ(D_IOCTL, req, "no set_info val");
02118                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
02119         }
02120         vallen = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_VAL,
02121                                       RCL_CLIENT);
02122 
02123         /* We are responsible for swabbing contents of val */
02124 
02125         if (KEY_IS(KEY_HSM_COPYTOOL_SEND))
02126                 /* Pass it on to mdc (the "export" in this case) */
02127                 rc = obd_set_info_async(req->rq_svc_thread->t_env,
02128                                         req->rq_export,
02129                                         sizeof(KEY_HSM_COPYTOOL_SEND),
02130                                         KEY_HSM_COPYTOOL_SEND,
02131                                         vallen, val, NULL);
02132         else
02133                 DEBUG_REQ(D_WARNING, req, "ignoring unknown key %s", key);
02134 
02135         return rc;
02136 }
02137 
02138 static inline void ldlm_callback_errmsg(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02139                                         const char *msg, int rc,
02140                                         const struct lustre_handle *handle)
02141 {
02142         DEBUG_REQ((req->rq_no_reply || rc) ? D_WARNING : D_DLMTRACE, req,
02143                   "%s: [nid %s] [rc %d] [lock "LPX64"]",
02144                   msg, libcfs_id2str(req->rq_peer), rc,
02145                   handle ? handle->cookie : 0);
02146         if (req->rq_no_reply)
02147                 CWARN("No reply was sent, maybe cause bug 21636.\n");
02148         else if (rc)
02149                 CWARN("Send reply failed, maybe cause bug 21636.\n");
02150 }
02151 
02152 /* TODO: handle requests in a similar way as MDT: see mdt_handle_common() */
02153 static int ldlm_callback_handler(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02154 {
02155         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
02156         struct ldlm_request *dlm_req;
02157         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02158         int rc;
02159         ENTRY;
02160 
02161         /* Requests arrive in sender's byte order.  The ptlrpc service
02162          * handler has already checked and, if necessary, byte-swapped the
02163          * incoming request message body, but I am responsible for the
02164          * message buffers. */
02165 
02166         /* do nothing for sec context finalize */
02167         if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == SEC_CTX_FINI)
02168                 RETURN(0);
02169 
02170         req_capsule_init(&req->rq_pill, req, RCL_SERVER);
02171 
02172         if (req->rq_export == NULL) {
02173                 rc = ldlm_callback_reply(req, -ENOTCONN);
02174                 ldlm_callback_errmsg(req, "Operate on unconnected server",
02175                                      rc, NULL);
02176                 RETURN(0);
02177         }
02178 
02179         LASSERT(req->rq_export != NULL);
02180         LASSERT(req->rq_export->exp_obd != NULL);
02181 
02182         switch (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
02183         case LDLM_BL_CALLBACK:
02184                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_BL_CALLBACK_NET)) {
02185                         if (cfs_fail_err)
02186                                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, -(int)cfs_fail_err);
02187                         RETURN(0);
02188                 }
02189                 break;
02190         case LDLM_CP_CALLBACK:
02191                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_CALLBACK_NET))
02192                         RETURN(0);
02193                 break;
02194         case LDLM_GL_CALLBACK:
02195                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_GL_CALLBACK_NET))
02196                         RETURN(0);
02197                 break;
02198         case LDLM_SET_INFO:
02199                 rc = ldlm_handle_setinfo(req);
02200                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, rc);
02201                 RETURN(0);
02202         case LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_CREATE:
02203                 req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_CREATE);
02204                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OBD_LOGD_NET))
02205                         RETURN(0);
02206                 rc = llog_origin_handle_open(req);
02207                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, rc);
02208                 RETURN(0);
02209         case LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_NEXT_BLOCK:
02210                 req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill,
02211                                 &RQF_LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_NEXT_BLOCK);
02212                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OBD_LOGD_NET))
02213                         RETURN(0);
02214                 rc = llog_origin_handle_next_block(req);
02215                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, rc);
02216                 RETURN(0);
02217         case LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_READ_HEADER:
02218                 req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill,
02219                                 &RQF_LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_READ_HEADER);
02220                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OBD_LOGD_NET))
02221                         RETURN(0);
02222                 rc = llog_origin_handle_read_header(req);
02223                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, rc);
02224                 RETURN(0);
02225         case LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_CLOSE:
02226                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OBD_LOGD_NET))
02227                         RETURN(0);
02228                 rc = llog_origin_handle_close(req);
02229                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, rc);
02230                 RETURN(0);
02231         default:
02232                 CERROR("unknown opcode %u\n",
02233                        lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg));
02234                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, -EPROTO);
02235                 RETURN(0);
02236         }
02237 
02238         ns = req->rq_export->exp_obd->obd_namespace;
02239         LASSERT(ns != NULL);
02240 
02241         req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_CALLBACK);
02242 
02243         dlm_req = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
02244         if (dlm_req == NULL) {
02245                 rc = ldlm_callback_reply(req, -EPROTO);
02246                 ldlm_callback_errmsg(req, "Operate without parameter", rc,
02247                                      NULL);
02248                 RETURN(0);
02249         }
02250 
02251         /* Force a known safe race, send a cancel to the server for a lock
02252          * which the server has already started a blocking callback on. */
02253         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CANCEL_BL_CB_RACE) &&
02254             lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == LDLM_BL_CALLBACK) {
02255                 rc = ldlm_cli_cancel(&dlm_req->lock_handle[0], 0);
02256                 if (rc < 0)
02257                         CERROR("ldlm_cli_cancel: %d\n", rc);
02258         }
02259 
02260         lock = ldlm_handle2lock_long(&dlm_req->lock_handle[0], 0);
02261         if (!lock) {
02262                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "callback on lock "LPX64" - lock "
02263                        "disappeared\n", dlm_req->lock_handle[0].cookie);
02264                 rc = ldlm_callback_reply(req, -EINVAL);
02265                 ldlm_callback_errmsg(req, "Operate with invalid parameter", rc,
02266                                      &dlm_req->lock_handle[0]);
02267                 RETURN(0);
02268         }
02269 
02270         if (ldlm_is_fail_loc(lock) &&
02271             lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == LDLM_BL_CALLBACK)
02272                 OBD_RACE(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CP_BL_RACE);
02273 
02274         /* Copy hints/flags (e.g. LDLM_FL_DISCARD_DATA) from AST. */
02275         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
02276         lock->l_flags |= ldlm_flags_from_wire(dlm_req->lock_flags &
02277                                               LDLM_FL_AST_MASK);
02278         if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == LDLM_BL_CALLBACK) {
02279                 /* If somebody cancels lock and cache is already dropped,
02280                  * or lock is failed before cp_ast received on client,
02281                  * we can tell the server we have no lock. Otherwise, we
02282                  * should send cancel after dropping the cache. */
02283                 if ((ldlm_is_canceling(lock) && ldlm_is_bl_done(lock)) ||
02284                      ldlm_is_failed(lock)) {
02285                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "callback on lock "
02286                                    LPX64" - lock disappeared",
02287                                    dlm_req->lock_handle[0].cookie);
02288                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02289                         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
02290                         rc = ldlm_callback_reply(req, -EINVAL);
02291                         ldlm_callback_errmsg(req, "Operate on stale lock", rc,
02292                                              &dlm_req->lock_handle[0]);
02293                         RETURN(0);
02294                 }
02295                 /* BL_AST locks are not needed in LRU.
02296                  * Let ldlm_cancel_lru() be fast. */
02297                 ldlm_lock_remove_from_lru(lock);
02298                 ldlm_set_bl_ast(lock);
02299         }
02300         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02301 
02302         /* We want the ost thread to get this reply so that it can respond
02303          * to ost requests (write cache writeback) that might be triggered
02304          * in the callback.
02305          *
02306          * But we'd also like to be able to indicate in the reply that we're
02307          * cancelling right now, because it's unused, or have an intent result
02308          * in the reply, so we might have to push the responsibility for sending
02309          * the reply down into the AST handlers, alas. */
02310 
02311         switch (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
02312         case LDLM_BL_CALLBACK:
02313                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "blocking ast\n");
02314                 req_capsule_extend(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_BL_CALLBACK);
02315                 if (!ldlm_is_cancel_on_block(lock)) {
02316                         rc = ldlm_callback_reply(req, 0);
02317                         if (req->rq_no_reply || rc)
02318                                 ldlm_callback_errmsg(req, "Normal process", rc,
02319                                                      &dlm_req->lock_handle[0]);
02320                 }
02321                 if (ldlm_bl_to_thread_lock(ns, &dlm_req->lock_desc, lock))
02322                         ldlm_handle_bl_callback(ns, &dlm_req->lock_desc, lock);
02323                 break;
02324         case LDLM_CP_CALLBACK:
02325                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "completion ast\n");
02326                 req_capsule_extend(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_CP_CALLBACK);
02327                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, 0);
02328                 ldlm_handle_cp_callback(req, ns, dlm_req, lock);
02329                 break;
02330         case LDLM_GL_CALLBACK:
02331                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "glimpse ast\n");
02332                 req_capsule_extend(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_GL_CALLBACK);
02333                 ldlm_handle_gl_callback(req, ns, dlm_req, lock);
02334                 break;
02335         default:
02336                 LBUG();                         /* checked above */
02337         }
02338 
02339         RETURN(0);
02340 }
02341 
02342 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
02343 
02348 static int ldlm_cancel_handler(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02349 {
02350         int rc;
02351         ENTRY;
02352 
02353         /* Requests arrive in sender's byte order.  The ptlrpc service
02354          * handler has already checked and, if necessary, byte-swapped the
02355          * incoming request message body, but I am responsible for the
02356          * message buffers. */
02357 
02358         req_capsule_init(&req->rq_pill, req, RCL_SERVER);
02359 
02360         if (req->rq_export == NULL) {
02361                 struct ldlm_request *dlm_req;
02362 
02363                 CERROR("%s from %s arrived at %lu with bad export cookie "
02364                        LPU64"\n",
02365                        ll_opcode2str(lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg)),
02366                        libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
02367                        req->rq_arrival_time.tv_sec,
02368                        lustre_msg_get_handle(req->rq_reqmsg)->cookie);
02369 
02370                 if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == LDLM_CANCEL) {
02371                         req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_CALLBACK);
02372                         dlm_req = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill,
02373                                                          &RMF_DLM_REQ);
02374                         if (dlm_req != NULL)
02375                                 ldlm_lock_dump_handle(D_ERROR,
02376                                                       &dlm_req->lock_handle[0]);
02377                 }
02378                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, -ENOTCONN);
02379                 RETURN(0);
02380         }
02381 
02382         switch (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
02383 
02384         /* XXX FIXME move this back to mds/handler.c, bug 249 */
02385         case LDLM_CANCEL:
02386                 req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_CANCEL);
02387                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "cancel\n");
02388                 if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_CANCEL_NET) ||
02389                     CFS_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_CANCEL_RESEND) ||
02390                     CFS_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_BL_EVICT))
02391                         RETURN(0);
02392                 rc = ldlm_handle_cancel(req);
02393                 if (rc)
02394                         break;
02395                 RETURN(0);
02396         default:
02397                 CERROR("invalid opcode %d\n",
02398                        lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg));
02399                 req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_CALLBACK);
02400                 ldlm_callback_reply(req, -EINVAL);
02401         }
02402 
02403         RETURN(0);
02404 }
02405 
02406 static int ldlm_cancel_hpreq_lock_match(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02407                                         struct ldlm_lock *lock)
02408 {
02409         struct ldlm_request *dlm_req;
02410         struct lustre_handle lockh;
02411         int rc = 0;
02412         int i;
02413         ENTRY;
02414 
02415         dlm_req = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
02416         if (dlm_req == NULL)
02417                 RETURN(0);
02418 
02419         ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
02420         for (i = 0; i < dlm_req->lock_count; i++) {
02421                 if (lustre_handle_equal(&dlm_req->lock_handle[i],
02422                                         &lockh)) {
02423                         DEBUG_REQ(D_RPCTRACE, req,
02424                                   "Prio raised by lock "LPX64".", lockh.cookie);
02425 
02426                         rc = 1;
02427                         break;
02428                 }
02429         }
02430 
02431         RETURN(rc);
02432 
02433 }
02434 
02435 static int ldlm_cancel_hpreq_check(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02436 {
02437         struct ldlm_request *dlm_req;
02438         int rc = 0;
02439         int i;
02440         ENTRY;
02441 
02442         /* no prolong in recovery */
02443         if (lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REPLAY)
02444                 RETURN(0);
02445 
02446         dlm_req = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
02447         if (dlm_req == NULL)
02448                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
02449 
02450         for (i = 0; i < dlm_req->lock_count; i++) {
02451                 struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02452 
02453                 lock = ldlm_handle2lock(&dlm_req->lock_handle[i]);
02454                 if (lock == NULL)
02455                         continue;
02456 
02457                 rc = ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock) ? 1 : 0;
02458                 if (rc)
02459                         LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "hpreq cancel lock");
02460                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
02461 
02462                 if (rc)
02463                         break;
02464         }
02465 
02466         RETURN(rc);
02467 }
02468 
02469 static struct ptlrpc_hpreq_ops ldlm_cancel_hpreq_ops = {
02470         .hpreq_lock_match = ldlm_cancel_hpreq_lock_match,
02471         .hpreq_check      = ldlm_cancel_hpreq_check,
02472         .hpreq_fini       = NULL,
02473 };
02474 
02475 static int ldlm_hpreq_handler(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02476 {
02477         ENTRY;
02478 
02479         req_capsule_init(&req->rq_pill, req, RCL_SERVER);
02480 
02481         if (req->rq_export == NULL)
02482                 RETURN(0);
02483 
02484         if (LDLM_CANCEL == lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
02485                 req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_CANCEL);
02486                 req->rq_ops = &ldlm_cancel_hpreq_ops;
02487         }
02488         RETURN(0);
02489 }
02490 
02491 static int ldlm_revoke_lock_cb(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
02492                                struct hlist_node *hnode, void *data)
02493 
02494 {
02495         struct list_head         *rpc_list = data;
02496         struct ldlm_lock   *lock = cfs_hash_object(hs, hnode);
02497 
02498         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
02499 
02500         if (lock->l_req_mode != lock->l_granted_mode) {
02501                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02502                 return 0;
02503         }
02504 
02505         LASSERT(lock->l_resource);
02506         if (lock->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_IBITS &&
02507             lock->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_PLAIN) {
02508                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02509                 return 0;
02510         }
02511 
02512         if (ldlm_is_ast_sent(lock)) {
02513                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02514                 return 0;
02515         }
02516 
02517         LASSERT(lock->l_blocking_ast);
02518         LASSERT(!lock->l_blocking_lock);
02519 
02520         ldlm_set_ast_sent(lock);
02521         if (lock->l_export && lock->l_export->exp_lock_hash) {
02522                 /* NB: it's safe to call cfs_hash_del() even lock isn't
02523                  * in exp_lock_hash. */
02524                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
02525                  * ldlm_export_lock_keycmp() */
02526                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
02527                 cfs_hash_del(lock->l_export->exp_lock_hash,
02528                              &lock->l_remote_handle, &lock->l_exp_hash);
02529         }
02530 
02531         list_add_tail(&lock->l_rk_ast, rpc_list);
02532         LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
02533 
02534         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
02535         return 0;
02536 }
02537 
02538 void ldlm_revoke_export_locks(struct obd_export *exp)
02539 {
02540         struct list_head  rpc_list;
02541         ENTRY;
02542 
02543         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rpc_list);
02544         cfs_hash_for_each_empty(exp->exp_lock_hash,
02545                                 ldlm_revoke_lock_cb, &rpc_list);
02546         ldlm_run_ast_work(exp->exp_obd->obd_namespace, &rpc_list,
02547                           LDLM_WORK_REVOKE_AST);
02548 
02549         EXIT;
02550 }
02551 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_revoke_export_locks);
02552 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
02553 
02554 static int ldlm_bl_get_work(struct ldlm_bl_pool *blp,
02555                             struct ldlm_bl_work_item **p_blwi,
02556                             struct obd_export **p_exp)
02557 {
02558         struct ldlm_bl_work_item *blwi = NULL;
02559         static unsigned int num_bl = 0;
02560         static unsigned int num_stale;
02561         int num_th = atomic_read(&blp->blp_num_threads);
02562 
02563         *p_exp = obd_stale_export_get();
02564 
02565         spin_lock(&blp->blp_lock);
02566         if (*p_exp != NULL) {
02567                 if (num_th == 1 || ++num_stale < num_th) {
02568                         spin_unlock(&blp->blp_lock);
02569                         return 1;
02570                 } else {
02571                         num_stale = 0;
02572                 }
02573         }
02574 
02575         /* process a request from the blp_list at least every blp_num_threads */
02576         if (!list_empty(&blp->blp_list) &&
02577             (list_empty(&blp->blp_prio_list) || num_bl == 0))
02578                 blwi = list_entry(blp->blp_list.next,
02579                                   struct ldlm_bl_work_item, blwi_entry);
02580         else
02581                 if (!list_empty(&blp->blp_prio_list))
02582                         blwi = list_entry(blp->blp_prio_list.next,
02583                                           struct ldlm_bl_work_item,
02584                                           blwi_entry);
02585 
02586         if (blwi) {
02587                 if (++num_bl >= num_th)
02588                         num_bl = 0;
02589                 list_del(&blwi->blwi_entry);
02590         }
02591         spin_unlock(&blp->blp_lock);
02592         *p_blwi = blwi;
02593 
02594         if (*p_exp != NULL && *p_blwi != NULL) {
02595                 obd_stale_export_put(*p_exp);
02596                 *p_exp = NULL;
02597         }
02598 
02599         return (*p_blwi != NULL || *p_exp != NULL) ? 1 : 0;
02600 }
02601 
02602 /* This only contains temporary data until the thread starts */
02603 struct ldlm_bl_thread_data {
02604         struct ldlm_bl_pool     *bltd_blp;
02605         struct completion       bltd_comp;
02606         int                     bltd_num;
02607 };
02608 
02609 static int ldlm_bl_thread_main(void *arg);
02610 
02611 static int ldlm_bl_thread_start(struct ldlm_bl_pool *blp, bool check_busy)
02612 {
02613         struct ldlm_bl_thread_data bltd = { .bltd_blp = blp };
02614         struct task_struct *task;
02615 
02616         init_completion(&bltd.bltd_comp);
02617 
02618         bltd.bltd_num = atomic_inc_return(&blp->blp_num_threads);
02619         if (bltd.bltd_num >= blp->blp_max_threads) {
02620                 atomic_dec(&blp->blp_num_threads);
02621                 return 0;
02622         }
02623 
02624         LASSERTF(bltd.bltd_num > 0, "thread num:%d\n", bltd.bltd_num);
02625         if (check_busy &&
02626             atomic_read(&blp->blp_busy_threads) < (bltd.bltd_num - 1)) {
02627                 atomic_dec(&blp->blp_num_threads);
02628                 return 0;
02629         }
02630 
02631         task = kthread_run(ldlm_bl_thread_main, &bltd, "ldlm_bl_%02d",
02632                            bltd.bltd_num);
02633         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
02634                 CERROR("cannot start LDLM thread ldlm_bl_%02d: rc %ld\n",
02635                        bltd.bltd_num, PTR_ERR(task));
02636                 atomic_dec(&blp->blp_num_threads);
02637                 return PTR_ERR(task);
02638         }
02639         wait_for_completion(&bltd.bltd_comp);
02640 
02641         return 0;
02642 }
02643 
02644 /* Not fatal if racy and have a few too many threads */
02645 static int ldlm_bl_thread_need_create(struct ldlm_bl_pool *blp,
02646                                       struct ldlm_bl_work_item *blwi)
02647 {
02648         if (atomic_read(&blp->blp_num_threads) >= blp->blp_max_threads)
02649                 return 0;
02650 
02651         if (atomic_read(&blp->blp_busy_threads) <
02652             atomic_read(&blp->blp_num_threads))
02653                 return 0;
02654 
02655         if (blwi != NULL && (blwi->blwi_ns == NULL ||
02656                              blwi->blwi_mem_pressure))
02657                 return 0;
02658 
02659         return 1;
02660 }
02661 
02662 static int ldlm_bl_thread_blwi(struct ldlm_bl_pool *blp,
02663                                struct ldlm_bl_work_item *blwi)
02664 {
02665         ENTRY;
02666 
02667         if (blwi->blwi_ns == NULL)
02668                 /* added by ldlm_cleanup() */
02669                 RETURN(LDLM_ITER_STOP);
02670 
02671         if (blwi->blwi_mem_pressure)
02672                 memory_pressure_set();
02673 
02674         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_PAUSE_CANCEL2, 4);
02675 
02676         if (blwi->blwi_count) {
02677                 int count;
02678                 /* The special case when we cancel locks in lru
02679                  * asynchronously, we pass the list of locks here.
02680                  * Thus locks are marked LDLM_FL_CANCELING, but NOT
02681                  * canceled locally yet. */
02682                 count = ldlm_cli_cancel_list_local(&blwi->blwi_head,
02683                                                    blwi->blwi_count,
02684                                                    LCF_BL_AST);
02685                 ldlm_cli_cancel_list(&blwi->blwi_head, count, NULL,
02686                                      blwi->blwi_flags);
02687         } else {
02688                 ldlm_handle_bl_callback(blwi->blwi_ns, &blwi->blwi_ld,
02689                                         blwi->blwi_lock);
02690         }
02691         if (blwi->blwi_mem_pressure)
02692                 memory_pressure_clr();
02693 
02694         if (blwi->blwi_flags & LCF_ASYNC)
02695                 OBD_FREE(blwi, sizeof(*blwi));
02696         else
02697                 complete(&blwi->blwi_comp);
02698 
02699         RETURN(0);
02700 }
02701 
02708 static int ldlm_bl_thread_exports(struct ldlm_bl_pool *blp,
02709                                   struct obd_export *exp)
02710 {
02711         int num;
02712         ENTRY;
02713 
02714         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_BL_EVICT, 4);
02715 
02716         num = ldlm_export_cancel_blocked_locks(exp);
02717         if (num == 0)
02718                 ldlm_export_cancel_locks(exp);
02719 
02720         obd_stale_export_put(exp);
02721 
02722         RETURN(0);
02723 }
02724 
02725 
02733 static int ldlm_bl_thread_main(void *arg)
02734 {
02735         struct ldlm_bl_pool *blp;
02736         struct ldlm_bl_thread_data *bltd = arg;
02737         ENTRY;
02738 
02739         blp = bltd->bltd_blp;
02740 
02741         complete(&bltd->bltd_comp);
02742         /* cannot use bltd after this, it is only on caller's stack */
02743 
02744         while (1) {
02745                 struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
02746                 struct ldlm_bl_work_item *blwi = NULL;
02747                 struct obd_export *exp = NULL;
02748                 int rc;
02749 
02750                 rc = ldlm_bl_get_work(blp, &blwi, &exp);
02751 
02752                 if (rc == 0)
02753                         l_wait_event_exclusive(blp->blp_waitq,
02754                                                ldlm_bl_get_work(blp, &blwi,
02755                                                                 &exp),
02756                                                &lwi);
02757                 atomic_inc(&blp->blp_busy_threads);
02758 
02759                 if (ldlm_bl_thread_need_create(blp, blwi))
02760                         /* discard the return value, we tried */
02761                         ldlm_bl_thread_start(blp, true);
02762 
02763                 if (exp)
02764                         rc = ldlm_bl_thread_exports(blp, exp);
02765                 else if (blwi)
02766                         rc = ldlm_bl_thread_blwi(blp, blwi);
02767 
02768                 atomic_dec(&blp->blp_busy_threads);
02769 
02770                 if (rc == LDLM_ITER_STOP)
02771                         break;
02772         }
02773 
02774         atomic_dec(&blp->blp_num_threads);
02775         complete(&blp->blp_comp);
02776         RETURN(0);
02777 }
02778 
02779 
02780 static int ldlm_setup(void);
02781 static int ldlm_cleanup(void);
02782 
02783 int ldlm_get_ref(void)
02784 {
02785         int rc = 0;
02786         ENTRY;
02787         mutex_lock(&ldlm_ref_mutex);
02788         if (++ldlm_refcount == 1) {
02789                 rc = ldlm_setup();
02790                 if (rc)
02791                         ldlm_refcount--;
02792         }
02793         mutex_unlock(&ldlm_ref_mutex);
02794 
02795         RETURN(rc);
02796 }
02797 
02798 void ldlm_put_ref(void)
02799 {
02800         ENTRY;
02801         mutex_lock(&ldlm_ref_mutex);
02802         if (ldlm_refcount == 1) {
02803                 int rc = ldlm_cleanup();
02804                 if (rc)
02805                         CERROR("ldlm_cleanup failed: %d\n", rc);
02806                 else
02807                         ldlm_refcount--;
02808         } else {
02809                 ldlm_refcount--;
02810         }
02811         mutex_unlock(&ldlm_ref_mutex);
02812 
02813         EXIT;
02814 }
02815 
02816 /*
02817  * Export handle<->lock hash operations.
02818  */
02819 static unsigned
02820 ldlm_export_lock_hash(struct cfs_hash *hs, const void *key, unsigned mask)
02821 {
02822         return cfs_hash_u64_hash(((struct lustre_handle *)key)->cookie, mask);
02823 }
02824 
02825 static void *
02826 ldlm_export_lock_key(struct hlist_node *hnode)
02827 {
02828         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02829 
02830         lock = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_hash);
02831         return &lock->l_remote_handle;
02832 }
02833 
02834 static void
02835 ldlm_export_lock_keycpy(struct hlist_node *hnode, void *key)
02836 {
02837         struct ldlm_lock     *lock;
02838 
02839         lock = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_hash);
02840         lock->l_remote_handle = *(struct lustre_handle *)key;
02841 }
02842 
02843 static int
02844 ldlm_export_lock_keycmp(const void *key, struct hlist_node *hnode)
02845 {
02846         return lustre_handle_equal(ldlm_export_lock_key(hnode), key);
02847 }
02848 
02849 static void *
02850 ldlm_export_lock_object(struct hlist_node *hnode)
02851 {
02852         return hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_hash);
02853 }
02854 
02855 static void
02856 ldlm_export_lock_get(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
02857 {
02858         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02859 
02860         lock = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_hash);
02861         LDLM_LOCK_GET(lock);
02862 }
02863 
02864 static void
02865 ldlm_export_lock_put(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
02866 {
02867         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02868 
02869         lock = hlist_entry(hnode, struct ldlm_lock, l_exp_hash);
02870         LDLM_LOCK_RELEASE(lock);
02871 }
02872 
02873 static struct cfs_hash_ops ldlm_export_lock_ops = {
02874         .hs_hash        = ldlm_export_lock_hash,
02875         .hs_key         = ldlm_export_lock_key,
02876         .hs_keycmp      = ldlm_export_lock_keycmp,
02877         .hs_keycpy      = ldlm_export_lock_keycpy,
02878         .hs_object      = ldlm_export_lock_object,
02879         .hs_get         = ldlm_export_lock_get,
02880         .hs_put         = ldlm_export_lock_put,
02881         .hs_put_locked  = ldlm_export_lock_put,
02882 };
02883 
02884 int ldlm_init_export(struct obd_export *exp)
02885 {
02886         int rc;
02887         ENTRY;
02888 
02889         exp->exp_lock_hash =
02890                 cfs_hash_create(obd_uuid2str(&exp->exp_client_uuid),
02891                                 HASH_EXP_LOCK_CUR_BITS,
02892                                 HASH_EXP_LOCK_MAX_BITS,
02893                                 HASH_EXP_LOCK_BKT_BITS, 0,
02894                                 CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA, CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
02895                                 &ldlm_export_lock_ops,
02896                                 CFS_HASH_DEFAULT | CFS_HASH_REHASH_KEY |
02897                                 CFS_HASH_NBLK_CHANGE);
02898 
02899         if (!exp->exp_lock_hash)
02900                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02901 
02902         rc = ldlm_init_flock_export(exp);
02903         if (rc)
02904                 GOTO(err, rc);
02905 
02906         RETURN(0);
02907 err:
02908         ldlm_destroy_export(exp);
02909         RETURN(rc);
02910 }
02911 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_init_export);
02912 
02913 void ldlm_destroy_export(struct obd_export *exp)
02914 {
02915         ENTRY;
02916         cfs_hash_putref(exp->exp_lock_hash);
02917         exp->exp_lock_hash = NULL;
02918 
02919         ldlm_destroy_flock_export(exp);
02920         EXIT;
02921 }
02922 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_destroy_export);
02923 
02924 static int ldlm_setup(void)
02925 {
02926         static struct ptlrpc_service_conf       conf;
02927         struct ldlm_bl_pool                    *blp = NULL;
02928 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
02929         struct task_struct *task;
02930 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
02931         int i;
02932         int rc = 0;
02933 
02934         ENTRY;
02935 
02936         if (ldlm_state != NULL)
02937                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
02938 
02939         OBD_ALLOC(ldlm_state, sizeof(*ldlm_state));
02940         if (ldlm_state == NULL)
02941                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02942 
02943 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
02944         rc = ldlm_proc_setup();
02945         if (rc != 0)
02946                 GOTO(out, rc);
02947 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
02948 
02949         memset(&conf, 0, sizeof(conf));
02950         conf = (typeof(conf)) {
02951                 .psc_name               = "ldlm_cbd",
02952                 .psc_watchdog_factor    = 2,
02953                 .psc_buf                = {
02954                         .bc_nbufs               = LDLM_CLIENT_NBUFS,
02955                         .bc_buf_size            = LDLM_BUFSIZE,
02956                         .bc_req_max_size        = LDLM_MAXREQSIZE,
02957                         .bc_rep_max_size        = LDLM_MAXREPSIZE,
02958                         .bc_req_portal          = LDLM_CB_REQUEST_PORTAL,
02959                         .bc_rep_portal          = LDLM_CB_REPLY_PORTAL,
02960                 },
02961                 .psc_thr                = {
02962                         .tc_thr_name            = "ldlm_cb",
02963                         .tc_thr_factor          = LDLM_THR_FACTOR,
02964                         .tc_nthrs_init          = LDLM_NTHRS_INIT,
02965                         .tc_nthrs_base          = LDLM_NTHRS_BASE,
02966                         .tc_nthrs_max           = LDLM_NTHRS_MAX,
02967                         .tc_nthrs_user          = ldlm_num_threads,
02968                         .tc_cpu_affinity        = 1,
02969                         .tc_ctx_tags            = LCT_MD_THREAD | LCT_DT_THREAD,
02970                 },
02971                 .psc_cpt                = {
02972                         .cc_pattern             = ldlm_cpts,
02973                 },
02974                 .psc_ops                = {
02975                         .so_req_handler         = ldlm_callback_handler,
02976                 },
02977         };
02978         ldlm_state->ldlm_cb_service = \
02979                         ptlrpc_register_service(&conf, ldlm_svc_proc_dir);
02980         if (IS_ERR(ldlm_state->ldlm_cb_service)) {
02981                 CERROR("failed to start service\n");
02982                 rc = PTR_ERR(ldlm_state->ldlm_cb_service);
02983                 ldlm_state->ldlm_cb_service = NULL;
02984                 GOTO(out, rc);
02985         }
02986 
02987 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
02988         memset(&conf, 0, sizeof(conf));
02989         conf = (typeof(conf)) {
02990                 .psc_name               = "ldlm_canceld",
02991                 .psc_watchdog_factor    = 6,
02992                 .psc_buf                = {
02993                         .bc_nbufs               = LDLM_SERVER_NBUFS,
02994                         .bc_buf_size            = LDLM_BUFSIZE,
02995                         .bc_req_max_size        = LDLM_MAXREQSIZE,
02996                         .bc_rep_max_size        = LDLM_MAXREPSIZE,
02997                         .bc_req_portal          = LDLM_CANCEL_REQUEST_PORTAL,
02998                         .bc_rep_portal          = LDLM_CANCEL_REPLY_PORTAL,
02999 
03000                 },
03001                 .psc_thr                = {
03002                         .tc_thr_name            = "ldlm_cn",
03003                         .tc_thr_factor          = LDLM_THR_FACTOR,
03004                         .tc_nthrs_init          = LDLM_NTHRS_INIT,
03005                         .tc_nthrs_base          = LDLM_NTHRS_BASE,
03006                         .tc_nthrs_max           = LDLM_NTHRS_MAX,
03007                         .tc_nthrs_user          = ldlm_num_threads,
03008                         .tc_cpu_affinity        = 1,
03009                         .tc_ctx_tags            = LCT_MD_THREAD | \
03010                                                   LCT_DT_THREAD | \
03011                                                   LCT_CL_THREAD,
03012                 },
03013                 .psc_cpt                = {
03014                         .cc_pattern             = ldlm_cpts,
03015                 },
03016                 .psc_ops                = {
03017                         .so_req_handler         = ldlm_cancel_handler,
03018                         .so_hpreq_handler       = ldlm_hpreq_handler,
03019                 },
03020         };
03021         ldlm_state->ldlm_cancel_service = \
03022                         ptlrpc_register_service(&conf, ldlm_svc_proc_dir);
03023         if (IS_ERR(ldlm_state->ldlm_cancel_service)) {
03024                 CERROR("failed to start service\n");
03025                 rc = PTR_ERR(ldlm_state->ldlm_cancel_service);
03026                 ldlm_state->ldlm_cancel_service = NULL;
03027                 GOTO(out, rc);
03028         }
03029 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
03030 
03031         OBD_ALLOC(blp, sizeof(*blp));
03032         if (blp == NULL)
03033                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
03034         ldlm_state->ldlm_bl_pool = blp;
03035 
03036         spin_lock_init(&blp->blp_lock);
03037         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&blp->blp_list);
03038         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&blp->blp_prio_list);
03039         init_waitqueue_head(&blp->blp_waitq);
03040         atomic_set(&blp->blp_num_threads, 0);
03041         atomic_set(&blp->blp_busy_threads, 0);
03042 
03043         if (ldlm_num_threads == 0) {
03044                 blp->blp_min_threads = LDLM_NTHRS_INIT;
03045                 blp->blp_max_threads = LDLM_NTHRS_MAX;
03046         } else {
03047                 blp->blp_min_threads = blp->blp_max_threads = \
03048                         min_t(int, LDLM_NTHRS_MAX, max_t(int, LDLM_NTHRS_INIT,
03049                                                          ldlm_num_threads));
03050         }
03051 
03052         for (i = 0; i < blp->blp_min_threads; i++) {
03053                 rc = ldlm_bl_thread_start(blp, false);
03054                 if (rc < 0)
03055                         GOTO(out, rc);
03056         }
03057 
03058 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
03059         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&expired_lock_thread.elt_expired_locks);
03060         expired_lock_thread.elt_state = ELT_STOPPED;
03061         init_waitqueue_head(&expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq);
03062 
03063         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&waiting_locks_list);
03064         spin_lock_init(&waiting_locks_spinlock);
03065         cfs_timer_init(&waiting_locks_timer, waiting_locks_callback, NULL);
03066 
03067         task = kthread_run(expired_lock_main, NULL, "ldlm_elt");
03068         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
03069                 rc = PTR_ERR(task);
03070                 CERROR("Cannot start ldlm expired-lock thread: %d\n", rc);
03071                 GOTO(out, rc);
03072         }
03073 
03074         wait_event(expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq,
03075                        expired_lock_thread.elt_state == ELT_READY);
03076 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
03077 
03078         rc = ldlm_pools_init();
03079         if (rc) {
03080                 CERROR("Failed to initialize LDLM pools: %d\n", rc);
03081                 GOTO(out, rc);
03082         }
03083 
03084         rc = ldlm_reclaim_setup();
03085         if (rc) {
03086                 CERROR("Failed to setup reclaim thread: rc = %d\n", rc);
03087                 GOTO(out, rc);
03088         }
03089         RETURN(0);
03090 
03091  out:
03092         ldlm_cleanup();
03093         RETURN(rc);
03094 }
03095 
03096 static int ldlm_cleanup(void)
03097 {
03098         ENTRY;
03099 
03100         if (!list_empty(ldlm_namespace_list(LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER)) ||
03101             !list_empty(ldlm_namespace_list(LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT))) {
03102                 CERROR("ldlm still has namespaces; clean these up first.\n");
03103                 ldlm_dump_all_namespaces(LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER, D_DLMTRACE);
03104                 ldlm_dump_all_namespaces(LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT, D_DLMTRACE);
03105                 RETURN(-EBUSY);
03106         }
03107 
03108         ldlm_reclaim_cleanup();
03109         ldlm_pools_fini();
03110 
03111         if (ldlm_state->ldlm_bl_pool != NULL) {
03112                 struct ldlm_bl_pool *blp = ldlm_state->ldlm_bl_pool;
03113 
03114                 while (atomic_read(&blp->blp_num_threads) > 0) {
03115                         struct ldlm_bl_work_item blwi = { .blwi_ns = NULL };
03116 
03117                         init_completion(&blp->blp_comp);
03118 
03119                         spin_lock(&blp->blp_lock);
03120                         list_add_tail(&blwi.blwi_entry, &blp->blp_list);
03121                         wake_up(&blp->blp_waitq);
03122                         spin_unlock(&blp->blp_lock);
03123 
03124                         wait_for_completion(&blp->blp_comp);
03125                 }
03126 
03127                 OBD_FREE(blp, sizeof(*blp));
03128         }
03129 
03130         if (ldlm_state->ldlm_cb_service != NULL)
03131                 ptlrpc_unregister_service(ldlm_state->ldlm_cb_service);
03132 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
03133         if (ldlm_state->ldlm_cancel_service != NULL)
03134                 ptlrpc_unregister_service(ldlm_state->ldlm_cancel_service);
03135 #endif
03136 
03137         ldlm_proc_cleanup();
03138 
03139 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
03140         if (expired_lock_thread.elt_state != ELT_STOPPED) {
03141                 expired_lock_thread.elt_state = ELT_TERMINATE;
03142                 wake_up(&expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq);
03143                 wait_event(expired_lock_thread.elt_waitq,
03144                                expired_lock_thread.elt_state == ELT_STOPPED);
03145         }
03146 #endif
03147 
03148         OBD_FREE(ldlm_state, sizeof(*ldlm_state));
03149         ldlm_state = NULL;
03150 
03151         RETURN(0);
03152 }
03153 
03154 int ldlm_init(void)
03155 {
03156         mutex_init(&ldlm_ref_mutex);
03157         mutex_init(ldlm_namespace_lock(LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER));
03158         mutex_init(ldlm_namespace_lock(LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT));
03159 
03160         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ldlm_srv_namespace_list);
03161         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ldlm_cli_active_namespace_list);
03162         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ldlm_cli_inactive_namespace_list);
03163 
03164         ldlm_resource_slab = kmem_cache_create("ldlm_resources",
03165                                                sizeof(struct ldlm_resource), 0,
03166                                                SLAB_HWCACHE_ALIGN, NULL);
03167         if (ldlm_resource_slab == NULL)
03168                 return -ENOMEM;
03169 
03170         ldlm_lock_slab = kmem_cache_create("ldlm_locks",
03171                               sizeof(struct ldlm_lock), 0,
03172                               SLAB_HWCACHE_ALIGN | SLAB_DESTROY_BY_RCU, NULL);
03173         if (ldlm_lock_slab == NULL)
03174                 goto out_resource;
03175 
03176         ldlm_interval_slab = kmem_cache_create("interval_node",
03177                                         sizeof(struct ldlm_interval),
03178                                         0, SLAB_HWCACHE_ALIGN, NULL);
03179         if (ldlm_interval_slab == NULL)
03180                 goto out_lock;
03181 
03182         ldlm_interval_tree_slab = kmem_cache_create("interval_tree",
03183                         sizeof(struct ldlm_interval_tree) * LCK_MODE_NUM,
03184                         0, SLAB_HWCACHE_ALIGN, NULL);
03185         if (ldlm_interval_tree_slab == NULL)
03186                 goto out_interval;
03187 
03188 #if LUSTRE_TRACKS_LOCK_EXP_REFS
03189         class_export_dump_hook = ldlm_dump_export_locks;
03190 #endif
03191         return 0;
03192 
03193 out_interval:
03194         kmem_cache_destroy(ldlm_interval_slab);
03195 out_lock:
03196         kmem_cache_destroy(ldlm_lock_slab);
03197 out_resource:
03198         kmem_cache_destroy(ldlm_resource_slab);
03199 
03200         return -ENOMEM;
03201 }
03202 
03203 void ldlm_exit(void)
03204 {
03205         if (ldlm_refcount)
03206                 CERROR("ldlm_refcount is %d in ldlm_exit!\n", ldlm_refcount);
03207         kmem_cache_destroy(ldlm_resource_slab);
03208         /* ldlm_lock_put() use RCU to call ldlm_lock_free, so need call
03209          * synchronize_rcu() to wait a grace period elapsed, so that
03210          * ldlm_lock_free() get a chance to be called. */
03211         synchronize_rcu();
03212         kmem_cache_destroy(ldlm_lock_slab);
03213         kmem_cache_destroy(ldlm_interval_slab);
03214         kmem_cache_destroy(ldlm_interval_tree_slab);
03215 }
